Today, Mouna has requested a loan of 1500 USD from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. She plans to purchase merchandise for her shop to prepare herself for the school year, and she also wants to make some décor changes in her house. She hopes to further expand and enhance her business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 57-year-old borrower from Lebanon. He is married and has four children. He has more than 30 years of experience as a car mechanic. He says that his services are very good, as well as his work. He is proud of his extensive experience and honest work. He has been able to serve a wide range of clients, mainly people from his region. He decided on doing his work because he wanted to have an independent job since he prefers working on his own and wanted no need to depend on anyone. 

Today, for the fourth time, he has requested a loan from A. Majmoua, a Kiva partner, to purchase tools for his work, as well as pay his children's school tuition fees. His previous loans allowed him to improve his work and purchase more sophisticated tools. He hopes to further expand and enhance his business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Dona

texts.en:
Dona is a 45-year-old married woman from Lebanon. Dona has been selling beauty products from her home, and she is a mobile seller. She sells perfumes, beauty cremes, and women's accessories. Today, for the first time, she has requested a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase merchandise. Her clients are her friends, neighbors, and beauty and perfume shops. 

Dona decided on doing her business because she wanted to have an independent job and be able to manage her own schedule. She hopes to keep on improving her business by increasing her sales and offering better beauty products.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mbaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Mbaye L. est un commerçant qui vit à Kaolack la troisième ville économique du Sénégal .Son activité principale est la vente de pièces détachées motocyclettes .C'est une activité très rentable car kaolack est une zone carrefour et les taxi moto sont très développer.Monsieur L. sollicite ce crédit pour renforcer ses besoins en pièces de rechange car la demande est forte.Ainsi ,les bénéfices tirés lui serviront de gérer ses dépenses quotidiennes et l'éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Mr. Mbaye L. is an entrepreneur living in Kaolack, the third business city of Senegal. His main line of business is selling motorcycle parts. This is a very profitable activity as Kaolack is located at the crossroads and moto-taxis are widespread. Mr. L. is seeking a credit to increase his stock of spare parts as the demand is high. The income will allow him to take care of everyday expenses as well as his children’s education.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering his business

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra has been selling clothes since 2005. She sells women's and men's clothes. Zahra is a 43-year-old woman who lives in Lebanon with her husband and their two children. Today, for the first time, Zahra has requested a loan of 2000 USD from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase the new summer collection for her shop, as well as to repaint her house.

Zahra is always trying to fill and improve her shop with the latest collection in order to attract more clients. Her clients are her friends and neighbors. Zahra is a determined woman who does her best to improve her sales, as well as her home financial situation. She decided to work in order to provide the best to her children, which starts with the best education. She plans for the future to be able to improve her work.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and to repaint a home

loans.name: Isaaf

texts.en:
Isaaf is a 47-year-old single woman from Lebanon. Isaaf has been working as a hairdresser. She has over ten years of experience in her domain.

Isaaf also sells wedding dresses. Therefore, she has requested a loan of 1500 USD in order to purchase new wedding dresses. This is her second loan, and she repaid her previous loan on time. Her previous loan allowed her to improve her business and to help with her family expenses. Isaaf decided to have her business, because she has experience and knows how to treat her clients. In the future, she plans to continue improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase new wedding dresses

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is a 46-year-old woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband and their four children. Zahra has owned a grocery store since 2008. She decided on opening her store because she wanted to have an independent job which would allow her to supplement her husband's income and provide the best to her children. She sells canned food, groceries, candies, beverages, biscuits and lots more. 

Today, for the first time, she has requested a loan to purchase merchandise for her store. She hopes to continue improving her work in the coming year, as well as her financial situation.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Abass

texts.en:
Abass is a 36-year-old married man from Lebanon. He has two children. Since 2008, he has been working as a car cleaner. Abass has requested a loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase a cleaning machine for his work. This is the first time that he has requested a loan. His clients can be anyone. 

When Abass first started his business, he was lucky not to face difficulties. He decided on opening his business because he realized that it was needed in his region, as well as because he wanted to improve his family's financial situation. He hopes to continue to improve his business, as well as be able to provide the best education and life to his children.

loans.use: To purchase a cleaning machine for his work

loans.name: Abdoulaye

texts.fr: Monsieur Abdoulaye D. est un réparateur de motocyclette à KAOLACK une ville carrefour entre le Sénégal et la Gambie d'où les taxi motos occupent une grande place dans la circulation urbaine ,péri urbaine et également en zone rurale. connait bien le milieu car étant réparateur Monsieur D. sollicite ce crédit pour en acheter un et payer un employé pour lui faire le transport nécessaire . Les bénéfices obtenus de ce transport vont servir à soutenir ses parents qui vivent dans un village environnant
texts.en:
Mr. Abdolaye D. is a motorcycle mechanic in Kaoloack, a village that is located at the crossroads between Senegal and Gambia, so that moto-taxis play an important role in the urban, surban and rural traffic in the area. He knows this field well from being a mechanic. Mr. D. is seeking a credit to purchase a motorcycle for himself and to hire a driver who would transport passengers. The income will be used to support his parents who live in the nearby message.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing a motorcycle

loans.name: Houssein

texts.en:
Houssein is a 45-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and their five children. For the past 24 years, Houssein has been running a car repairing and painting business. Today, for the first time, he is requesting a loan of 1500 USD from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, in order to purchase tools for his work, as well as to change the décor of his house by purchasing a new couch and a washing machine. 

Houssein decided on doing his business because he learned it when he was young. Thanks to his long experience, he was able to build networking, and his clients, who are people from his region, mainly his friends and neighbors, feel comfortable repairing their cars at his garage. Hussein is trustworthy in his work. He hopes for the future, to keep on improving his work and always provide the best for his family.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 41-year-old motorcycle “boda boda” driver.  "Boda bodas" are privately owned motorcycles used extensively throughout Kenya for public transportation. Boda boda drivers pick up and drop off pay-as-you-go passengers as a motorcycle taxi.  Emmanuel operates from the municipal business center, where there is a constant flow of customers, and he has been in this business for 1 year.  

Emmanuel is married and has 4 children, 3 boys and 1 girl, from 8 to 15 years old. The primary business challenges he faces are stiff competition from competitors with more than one motorcycle plus regular breakdowns of his motorbike.   His wife is a tailor/dressmaker, a business Emmanuel was involved in before driving his motorcycle.

Emmanuel plans to use the 60,000 Kenyan Shilling loan to purchase a second motorcycle.  He has successfully repaid three previous loans of 20,000, 40,000, and 60,000 Shillings.

In the future, Emmanuel hopes to buy his own land and build a home.  In 5 years, he dreams of having at least five motorcycles operating as boda bodas and being involved in the taxi business.

He describes himself as hard-working, humble, and humorous.

loans.use: To purchase a second motorcycle

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with six children and all of them are at school.  She is looking after her father who is elderly and not working. She sells  second-hand clothes in  Bwaise  market. She has been in this business for four years. She sells these clothes to all categories of  people on a retail basis.  

Jane buys these clothes from Owino market, one of the leading markets in Uganda.  Her greatest challenge has been transportation. She works seven days a week. Besides this clothing business, she also  sells charcoal to get additional income. Jane is aspiring of seeing her business grow big and getting enough profits so that she can own a plot of land. 

Jane joined MCDT to boost her business by getting additional capital. She resides in and rents  a two-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 25-year-old owner of Dan's Shoe Designs, selling men's and women's shoes, slippers, and bags at a busy location near a major market. He has been in this business for five years, and he has one employee.

His primary business challenges are debtors who don't pay and insufficient space to hold his inventory. In addition to his shoe shop, Daniel also sells mobile phone accessories. Before selling shoes, he was involved in a cabbage supply business.

Daniel plans to use the 20,000-KES loan to purchase more shoes for resale to his customers. He has successfully repaid previous loans as large as 100,000 KES.

In the future, Daniel hopes to own a shoe manufacturing business. In five years, he dreams of having his own business premises.

Daniel describes himself as hardworking, ambitious, and God-fearing.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes for resale to his customers

loans.name: Elhadji Mansour

texts.fr: Monsieur Elhadji Mansour S. est un jeune vulgarisateur qui vie à KAOLACK ,la troisième ville économique du Sénégal dans la partie centrale du bassin arachidier ,qui est également une zone de carrefour entre le Sénégal et la Gambie. le but du prêt est l'acquisition de nouveaux matériaux et de chambre à air pour la réparation pneu qui est son activité principale . Ainsi, Monsieur S. pourra augmenter ses revenus et faire face à beaucoup de ses engagements à l'avenir
texts.en:
Mr. Elhadji Mansour S. is a young tire repairman living in Kaolack (Senegal’s third-ranking city by economic importance), in the central part of the peanut belt. The area is also a crossroads between Senegal and Gambia. The purpose of the loan is to purchase new material and inner tubes to repair tires, which is his main activity. Mr. S. will thus be able to increase his income and meet many of his future commitments.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
N. Edith has, for the last five years, been running her salon business in Mulago, Kampala. What has been winning for her in terms of attracting customers in the course of these years has been her good line of conduct.

For this married mother of four, having a well-educated family is a top priority. With profits from her business, she has strained every nerve to do this. In a month, she earns 450,000 shillings as profits and, with this loan, she is anticipating a favorable turn in her current circumstances as she carries conviction she will be able to buy new equipment like weavers for her saloon.

loans.use: To purchase newer equipment like weavers and hairdryers for her salon

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
Porfirio tiene 50 años es casado y tiene dos hijos. 

Porfirio y su esposa Guillermina tienen un negocio familiar que consiste en traer ropa de la ciudad de Lima. El tipo de ropa que trae son pantalones y casacas. Porfirio nos cuenta que ya son más de 4 años que tiene su negocio y le va muy bien, él pertenece al banco comunal Chaska Ñahui y ya son cinco años que pertenece a este grupo de  emprendedores, se podría decir  que  él es fundador del banco comunal. 

El manifiesta que quiere seguir trabajando con el banco comunal pues le dan un crédito rápido y por ese motivo requiere el préstamo, él va ir a comprar mercadería a la ciudad de Lima y va comprar  casacas y pantalones.
texts.en:
Porfirio is 50, married and has two children. Porfirio and his wife, Guillermina, have a small family business bringing clothing from Lima. The type of clothing he brings is pants and jackets. Porfirio says that they have had this business for more than 4 years and it has gone well. He belongs to the Chaska Ñahui communal bank and has belonged to this group of entrepreneurs for five years. It could be said that he is the founder of the communal bank. He says that he wants to continue working with his communal bank because they give him access to quick credit, which he now requires. He is going to Lima to buy merchandise and to buy jackets and pants.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise, such as jackets and pants.

loans.name: Siriana

texts.en:
Siriana is 25 years old. She installs, services, and repairs refrigeration, air conditioning, and other electrical and electronic equipment. She has been in business for five years, and she operates in town on a busy street that is easily accessible from the town center and from residential areas. Her customers are typically schools, government institutions, and individuals.

Siriana is married and has a son and a daughter.

The primary business challenge Siriana faces is losing bids to larger competitors in town. In addition to this business, Siriana also operates a small retail shop in her residential area, a business she started before her current one.

Siriana plans to use the 40,000-KES loan to purchase more electrical and electronic parts for installation and repair work. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 KES.

Siriana hopes to "bring up God-fearing children and initiate them into business." In five years, she would like to be a successful businesswoman and to expand her business into selling electrical and electronic hardware.

She describes herself as hardworking, sociable, and God-fearing.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical and electronic parts for installation and service work

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a married man with three children who all attend school. He has been operating his restaurant for one and a half years. His potential customers are neighbors and passersby. His previous occupation was in brickwork, and he has no other source of income. Geoffrey rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are rent and electricity.

With the loan of 20,000 KES, Geoffrey wants to buy one bag of beans, a bale of maize, wheat flour, and cooking fats and oils to sell in a shop. In business, Geoffrey faces the challenge of insecurity.

Geoffrey decided to join Yehu because of the consistency of their services and their quick loan processing period. In the future, he hopes to expand and incorporate a shop with his restaurant.

loans.use: To purchase one bag of beans, a bale of maize, wheat flour, and cooking fats and oils

loans.name: Tawopaneh V Group

texts.en:
These are small-scale businesswomen in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each to enable them to expand their businesses. With a loan of SLL 500,000, they will be able to add more inventory to their businesses, make more sales, and more profit. Consequently, they will be able to improve their standard of living by sending their children to school, feeding and clothing them. 

Salamatu K. (in the middle) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni 36 years ago. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is an architect; two of her children are attending primary school and the youngest is not of school-going age. 

Salamatu is a businesswoman who sells market food such as salt, palm oil (the most popular cooking oil), Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), and rice.  She has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying salt, palm oil, Maggi cubes, and rice wholesale.

loans.use: Buy salt, palm oil, Maggi cubes, and rice wholesale

loans.name: Sorbeh Group

texts.en:
Isatu (who is pictured first row on the left) is a 35-year-old businesswoman who lives in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone with her husband and their four children. Isatu has been selling palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), for many years now. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva field partner, Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), in order to purchase gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock. This is the first time that Isatu and her group members have requested a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Buy gallons of palm oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is married with four children. All of her children are in school. Sofia also looks after other family members. Sofia resides in and owns a three-room house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Sofia's main monthly expense is school fees.

Formerly, Sofia dealt in charcoal, but she changed her business to a retail shop. She has been in this business for a few months. Her customers are the local people. Sofia plans to use this loan to buy more merchandise, such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil.

Sofia works seven days a week. She depends on this job to make a living. Sofia aspires to begin selling by wholesale only. She decided to work with MCDT in order to acquire more capital for her business.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise, such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and cooking oil

loans.name: Salcost Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Salcost” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of SLL 800,000 for each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Wara T. who is pictured second from right. Wara is age 28 and was born in Makeni. She is single with one child who is attending primary school.  For many years now, Wara has been selling palm oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), vegetable oil, and rice. Wara will use her share of the loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, vegetable oil, and rice

loans.name: Wofunira Women's Group 2, Kampala

texts.en:
For a period stretching to three years now, hardworking and self-motivated Ruth K. has been plying her salon business in Zana-Kampala. She also ekes out supplementary profits from her poultry business.

Though she is only three years down the road, this married mother of three children has made lots of headway in terms of consolidating her gains. In a week, she makes profits to the tune of 200,000 shillings. This has lent her enormous countenance in her drive to elevate the welfare of her family. All her three children are happily in good schools around Kampala.

Ruth’s startup business story can be traced to her erstwhile shop business. This gave her that sense of self-esteem that she could not fail in any business endeavor. With this loan, she is hoping she will be able to purchase new dryers. At length, she wants to expand her salon so that she is in a position to take on bridal services, too.

loans.use: To purchase hairdryers and other salon equipment

loans.name: Hard Work Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Hard Work” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, in order to seek a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit and consequently improve their living conditions. 

The leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Kadie K.. Kadie was born in Makeni about 45 years ago. She is married and has 6 children. Her husband is a professional worker and 3 of her children are attending schools. 

Kadie sells cooked rice and “gara lappers” (locally dyed clothes). Kadie has had many years of experience in business. With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking materials and "gara lapper" making materials wholesale.

loans.use: Buy cooking materials and "gara lapper" making materials wholesale

loans.name: Kateba Group

texts.en:
These are members of the “Kateba” group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs in the northern city of Makeni. They have applied for a loan of SLL 800,000 for each from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to improve their businesses.
 
John K. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. John was born in Makeni. He is about 40 years of age, married to a businesswoman and they have 2 children who are attending primary and secondary schools respectively. John is a tailor and has been in this profession for many years now. With the help of this loan, John will buy working materials like zippers, thread, poplin, other cloth, etc.

loans.use: Buy working materials like zippers, thread, poplin, other cloth, etc.

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
OIn the photo are members of the “Unity” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. They have applied for a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Memunatu T. who is pictured on the left. Memunatu is age 40; she was born in Makeni. She is married to a businessman and they have 5 children. Three of her children are attending primary school and 2 are in secondary school.

Memunatu sells firewood and fried cakes. She has been doing this business for many years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy piles of firewood, a bag of flour, gallons of frying oil, etc. in order to expand the size of her business.

loans.use: Buy piles of firewood, a bag of flour, gallons of frying oil, etc.

loans.name: Wofunira Women's Group 1, Kampala

texts.en:
She is a 40-year-old married mother with four children. To shoulder her responsibilities as a family breadwinner, N. Sarah has been selling electrical gadgets for the last five years in Kampala. This business has sustained her and her family due to the hard work, time and investment, she has put in.

Sarah’s journey into this business was like a leap in the dark by virtue of the fact that she did not have any prior business experience. She had to go through the tough mill of running a business with no requisite experience. Her high sense of self esteem was the trump card she played in getting herself acquainted with operating a business. Her resilience has paid off given her business longevity.

Sarah makes profits to the tune of 200,000 shillings a month. With this loan, she says she wants to buy more electrical items like bulbs, switches and PVC-covered wire for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more electrical items like bulbs and switches

loans.name: Make It Up Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Make It Up” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Haja K. (pictured in the middle of the back row) is the leader of this group. The 28-year-old is married to a school teacher and they have 3 children. Haja has been a businesswoman for 5 years now, she sells rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, Maggi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), gari (quick cooking food made out of cassava roots), etc.  With her share of this loan, she will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: Buy rice, palm oil, vegetable oil, Maggi cubes, gari (cassava couscous), etc.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, es un hombre emprendedor que está cumpliendo sus metas, tiene 51 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, junto a su esposa Dina, de 45 años y sus dos hijos, siendo el mayor de su primer compromiso y actualmente vive en la ciudad de Huancayo por motivos académicos. Es entonces que con la ayuda de su esposa y el menor de sus hijos, desde muy temprano en la mañana abren las puertas de su fuente de soda, para ofrecer a sus clientes deliciosas hamburguesas de pollo, papas fritas y ensalada de lechuga, acompañadas bebidas gasificas y bebidas calientes. Lleva 10 años dedicada a este negocio a lado de su familia y a diario obtiene entre S/. 250.00 a S/. 300.00 soles de venta. Parte de su éxito en el negocio, es la buena sazón con que preparan sus platillos además de la amabilidad con atiende a sus clientes. Su negocio le es muy rentable, es por ello que quiere incrementar su negocio, con productos de primera necesidad, además de ampliar su establecimiento. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y está motivado de continuar en su grupo comunal ya que conoce la metodología de trabajo de sus compañeros. Con los quinientos soles que solicita, comprará insumos para preparar sus hamburguesas, además desea comprarse una licuadora.
texts.en:
Jesus is an enterprising man who is meeting his goals. He is 51 years of age and lives in his parents’ home along with his wife Dina, 45, and his two sons, the eldest of whom is from his first marriage and currently lives in the city of Huancayo for academic reasons. Thus with the help of his wife and the younger of his sons, at a very early hour of the morning they open the doors of their soda fountain to offer their customers delicious chicken burgers, french fries and lettuce salads, along with sodas and hot drinks. He has been running this business along with his family for ten years, and takes in between 250 and 300 soles in daily sales. Part of his success in the business is the good seasoning with which they prepare their dishes, in addition to the friendliness with which he serves his customers. His business is very profitable and therefore he would like to grow his business to include grocery items and by expanding his premises. This is the fourth time he has obtained a loan with MFP and he is motivated to continue on with his communal bank since he is familiar with the work methodology of his co-members. With the 500 soles he is requesting he will buy supplies for preparing his burgers and also wishes to purchase a blender.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies for preparing burgers

loans.name: Tamaraneh V Group

texts.en:
Meet members of the “Tamaraneh V” group from Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Fatmata I. K. (pictured first row, right) is the leader of this group. The 40-year-old is married and has 4 children – 2 of her children are attending primary school and 2 are attending secondary school. Fatmata has been a businesswoman for five years now; she sells dishes, plates, spoons, cups, bowls, etc. With her share of this loan, Fatmata will buy the above-mentioned items wholesale to add to her current inventory.

loans.use: Buy dishes, plates, spoons, cups, bowls, etc. for resale

loans.name: Zapatitos Group

texts.es:
“Zapatitos”  es un grupo de 7 señoras y 1 varón que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Collpani”,  su presidenta es Carmen A. de 43 años, trabaja con Pro Mujer hace 10 años aproximadamente, ha estado en  diferentes grupos. Carmen se dedica a la costura de prendas de vestir, especializando en chamarras, con el pasar del tiempo pudo hacer crecer su negocio y generar empleo. Carmen adquiere su mercadería de la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto y vende sus productos en ésta misma ciudad ya que tiene un lugar de venta, además indica que le gusta compartir con sus amigas en las reuniones.
En esta oportunidad esta solicitando Bs.- 1500 para comprar tela. Las demás integrantes de ésta Asociación Comunal  tienen diversos negocios de producción, servicio y comercio.
texts.en:
“Zapatitos” (Little Shoes) is a group composed of seven women and one man who attend their meetings at the Collpani Community Center. The group president is Carmen A.. She is 43 years old and has worked with different groups within Pro Mujer for approximately 10 years.

Carmen is a seamstress who specializes in making jackets. Over time she has been able to grow her business and create jobs. Carmen acquires her supplies from the outskirts of the city of El Alto and then sells her products in the same city. She already has a place where she sells her merchandise. Carmen says she enjoys sharing with her friends during their meetings. At the moment, she is requesting 1500 BOB in order to buy fabric.

The other members of this Communal Association have different businesses in the manufacturing, service, and retail sectors.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making jackets

loans.name: Woman Labour Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Woman Labour” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Memuna J. who is pictured second from left. Memuna J. is age 43; she was born in Makeni, where she is currently residing, together with her husband and four children. Two of Memuna’s children are attending secondary school.

Mumuna sells locally dyed cloth called “gara lappers” and dishes. She has been doing business for many years. She wants a loan of SLL 500,000 to help her further boost her business. With the help of this loan, she will buy "gara lapper"-making materials like inks, caustic soda, powder, white cottons and she will pay workers who make designs on the white cottons.

loans.use: Buy "gara lapper"-making materials like inks, caustic soda, powder, white cottons, etc.

loans.name: New London Group

texts.en:
Claudia C. (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Claudia was born in Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. Claudia is 35 years old. She is married to a farmer and the couple has 4 children, 3 of whom are attending school. 

For over 5 years now, Claudia has been selling firewood, fried cakes and boiled cassavas and potatoes. This is the first loan that Claudia and her group members have applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Claudia will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to expand her business; she will buy firewood, cassava roots and potatoes wholesale.

loans.use: Buy firewood, cassava roots, and potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz Group

texts.es:
“Zapatito Veloz” es un grupo de 11 miembros (10 mujeres y un varon) que asisten a sus reuniones en el Centro Focal “Collpani”. Se agruparon por la necesidad de mejorar y ampliar sus negocios y de esta manera acceder al préstamo y beneficiarse todas. 
Una de las integrantes es Felipa P. que ingreso al grupo por invitación de sus amigas y porque necesitaba dinero para ampliar su negocio, Felipa se dedica a la producción de prendas de vestir hace 20 años, inicio este negocio con su esposo y a medida que crecía la familia el negocio también iba mejorando. Ahora Felipa necesita el préstamo para comprar tela y seguir produciendo productos, cuenta con el apoyo de sus dos hijas menores.
 Las demás integrantes tienen diversos negocios que se dedican a comercio, producción y servicio. Todas requieren el préstamo para mejorar sus negocios.

En la foto sale el esposo de una de las socias; hay otra socia que no estaba presente en el momento de sacar la foto.
texts.en:
“Zapatito Veloz” (Nimble Little Shoe) is a group of 11 members (10 women and one man) who attend their meetings at the Collpani Community Center. They formed a group because they wanted to improve and expand their businesses, as well as access a loan that could benefit all of them. One of the members is Felipa P.. She joined the group because she was invited by her friends and needed money to expand her business. Felipa has been manufacturing clothing for 20 years. She started her business with her husband and it improved as her family kept growing. At the moment, Felipa needs a loan to buy fabric so that she can continue making her products. She also has the support of her two young daughters. The other members have different businesses in the retail, manufacturing, and service sectors. They all need this loan to improve their businesses. The photo includes the husband of one of the borrowers; another group member was not present for the photo.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric for making clothes

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort A. is married and has three children. She operates a shop where she virtually sells almost everything her customers request. She has received senior high education. Her husband is a mason.  Comfort uses her income to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills.  Comfort will use the loan to purchase more groceries for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort plans to add to her working capital.

loans.use: purchase more groceries for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Y. sells cups of rice and 'gari' (cassava couscous) at Takoradi. She is married and has two children. She has been through junior high school. Her husband is a driver.  

Elizabeth uses her income to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills.  She will use the loan to purchase more bags of rice and 'gari' to be sold in smaller quantities. With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to plough what she can back into her business.

loans.use: purchase more bags of rice and 'gari'

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura, de 32 años, vive con su hijo  en la casa de sus padres.Desde hace 10 años vende  golosinas en la entrada de una escuela primaria de la zona por donde vive. Vende durante todos los días y descansa los fines  de semana, porque no hay clases, con el pasar de los años se dio cuenta de las ventajas del  sacrificado  trabajo que requería  su negocio, y poco a poco logro incrementar su capital de trabajo. Ella esta muy satisfecha porque obtiene buenas ganancias, es por esta razón que ha decidido aumentar más la cantidad de su mercadería.Es el 11avo crédito que  tiene  con MFP, y promete ser  muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible  el préstamo, porque le será  muy útil en el progreso de su puesto.Con el dinero solicitado Rosaura tiene planeado comprar un  triciclo más y cantidad de gaseosas que necesita para mejorar la variedad de productos que comercializa, pues desea ofrecer lo  mejor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosaura is 32 years old and lives with her son at her parents’ house. For the past ten years, she has been selling candy at the entrance of an elementary school in the area where she lives. She sells during the weekdays and takes a rest on the weekends since no classes are held during that time. As the years passed, Rosaura discovered the advantages of making the sacrifices needed to run a business and gradually increased her operating capital. She is very happy because she generates good earnings. For this reason, she has decided to increase the quantity of merchandise that she offers.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP. Rosaura promises to be responsible with her payments and thanks everyone who made this loan possible because it will be useful in advancing her business. With the money she requested, Rosaura plans to buy a tricycle and a large quantity of sodas to improve the variety of products that she sells. She wants to offer the best to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a tricycle & a large quantity of sodas for her business

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en: Alberta A. sells cooked rice with tomatoes and fried chicken at Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Alberta has received junior high education. Her husband is a businessman. Her loan will be used to buy bags of rice and frozen chicken for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: buy bags of rice and frozen chicken for sale

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es: Rosaura, de 21 años, vive en la casa de sus padres.Desde hace 4 años, vende  ropa y zapatos  que comercializa  a su clientela fija, y que  atiende llevando  la mercadería  a las casas de sus clientes. Vende muy bien los modelos nuevos que adquiere, además comercializa en su centro de estudios, a sus  compañeras de clase, que le hacen regulares pedidos. Ella ofrece al crédito y acuerda con sus clientes  para cancelar en cómodas cuotas. De esta manera  tiene la libertad de generarse mayores ganancias, por lo que ha visto que su negocio es muy rentable, y a futuro quiere incrementar la cantidad de clientes.Es la tercera vez  que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Rosaura tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de cantidad de prendas de vestir y zapatos para damas, pues tiene varios pedidos por cumplir.
texts.en:
Rosaura, 21, lives in her parents’ house. For four years she has been selling clothes and shoes, which she markets to her steady clientele, and she brings merchandise to her customers’ homes. She does a good job of selling the new styles that she buys, selling to classmates at her school, who make regular orders. She extends credit to customers and lets them pay in easy installments. This gives her the freedom to generate greater earnings. From what she has seen, her business is very profitable and in the future she wants to increase the amount of customers. This is the third time that Rosaura has a loan from Microfinanzas Prisma and she commits to being very responsible with her payments. In addition, she thanks all of the people that made the loan possible. It will be very helpful to her in the progress of her business. Rosaura has planned to invest the capital requested in the quantity purchase of women’s clothing and shoes since has several orders to fulfill.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Merchandise

loans.name: Dinora Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Dinora es una mujer trabajadora a sus 65 años de edad, sigue trabajando junto con su esposo.
Su negocio es una pulpería y venta de cocinas eléctrica elaboradas de metal y de costo bajo,  desde hace varios años inicio con dinero que su esposo dio.
Pues sus ventas en la pulpería están bajas y es con la venta de cocinas que se ayudan para lograr pagar sus pagos básicos de agua y luz. 
Con este préstamo comprara materiales de metal, pintura, alambre eléctrico y otro para la elaboración de cocina quien es su esposo quien las elabora, que es su otra fuente de entrada y que quiere elevar su producción. Contenta por que a través de estos financiamientos ha logrado la inversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Doña Dinora is a 65 year old woman who continues to work hard alongside her husband. She manages a grocery store and also sells electrical hot plates that are inexpensive and made of metal. Dinora started this business several years ago using money that her husband gave her.

Whenever her grocery sales are low, selling hot plates helps her pay for basic expenses such as water and electricity. This loan will be used to buy materials such as metal, paint, electrical wire, and other supplies for making hot plates. Her husband is responsible for producing these items, but since he is the only source of labor, she wants to increase production. Dinora is happy that these loans are available for her to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials used to make electrical hot plates

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 62 años, comparte su vida a lado de su esposa y de su último hijo de 14 años, juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 20 años tiene su establecimiento donde vende todo tipo de artículos de  ferretería, instalada dentro de su propio domicilio, en donde estratégicamente esta ubicada en una avenida  muy transitada de su barrio. De esa manera le facilita el trabajo, ya que son muchos quienes transitan cerca y acuden a su establecimiento. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposan en donde atiende a sus clientes. Por el momento desea incrementar de mercadería para su  ferretería. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que es muy responsable con sus pagos y agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con éste crédito que recibirá, comprará tuberías de plástico para instalaciones eléctricas.
texts.en:
Jorge is 62 years old and shares his life with his wife and their youngest son who is 14. They live together in their own home. For more than 20 years, Jorge has operated an establishment where he sells all types of hardware items. The store is located in his house, which is strategically located on one of the busiest streets in the neighborhood. This makes his work easier since many people who walk by come into his establishment. Sometimes his wife helps attend to the customers. At the moment, Jorge wants to increase the inventory of merchandise in his hardware store.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. Jorge is very responsible with his payments. He thanks everyone responsible for issuing the loan he requested because it will be very useful in advancing his business. The loan he received will be used to buy plastic tubing for electrical installations.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase plastic tubing to add to his inventory

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Serah E. moves from one house to another with her cosmetics for sale at Takoradi.  Serah has received junior high education.  She is married and has five dependents. Serah has been selling cosmetics for some time now. She helps her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more cosmetics to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to acquire a plot of land.

loans.use: buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Richard Eduardo

texts.es: Richard tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente tine una hija de 6 meses de edad, el y su familia viven en la casa de su suegra, vivienda que esta ubicada en AA.HH Tarapaca en casa de adobe de un piso. Richar se dedica a prestar servicio de transporte urbano por la ciudad, en una moto taxi alquilada. Se inicio desde muy joven a esta actividad. Su sueño y objetivo es poder tener su vehiculo propio, con el dinero que solicita sera para gastos personales, construira una parte del terreno que le dio su suegra.
texts.en:
Richard is 24 years old year old, in a common marriage, and has a six month old daughter. He and his family live in the adobe house of his mother-in-law which is located in the settlement of Tarapaca. Richard provides urban transportation services throughout the city using a rented motorcycle taxi. He started this business at a very young age. His dream and goal is to have his own vehicle. The money he requested will be used for personal expenses, specifically to start building on part of the land given to him by his mother-in-law.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To begin building on the land given to him by his mother-in-law

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma, de 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 23 años se dedica a la compra y venta de animales en la feria ganadera de su zona. En un inicio vendía animales de ganado vacuno, pero en la actualidad también vende ovejas y cerdos, en menor proporción, que  compra y luego revende a un mayor precio. Los animales que le sobran de sus ventas los tiene en su casa para engordarlos y venderlos, después  a un mejor precio, durante los fines de semana. Para desarrollar esta labor y transporte de sus animales cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. La comercialización de animales es muy rentable, y ha decidido incrementar su capital de trabajo. Es la 11ava vez  que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible  el préstamo porque  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Vilma tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de cantidad de cerdos, pues quiere aumentar la comercialización de éstos animales.
texts.en:
Vilma is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and three children. For 23 years, she has been buying and selling animals at the local livestock fair. She started selling cattle, but at the moment she also sells sheep and pigs to a lesser extent. Vilma purchases the animals and then sells them at a higher price. She takes home any animals that remain unsold and fattens them to sell later for a better price, usually on the weekends. Vilma relies on the help of her children to carry out her business and transport the animals. Selling animals is a profitable business, so she has decided to increase her operating capital.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP. Vilma promises to be responsible with all of her payments and thanks everyone who made this loan possible because it will be useful in advancing her business. With the money she requested, Vilma plans to buy a large quantity of pigs because she wants to increase her sales of this type of animal.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en: Nancy B. sells porridge powder (cereals such as maize, groundnuts and soy beans that have been milled into a powdered form) at Takoradi.  Nancy has received junior high education.  She is married to a driver. She helps her husband in taking care of the family. Her loan will be added to her working capital to improve her business and increase her sales of the powdered cereals. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to acquire a plot of land.

loans.use: increase her sales of the powdered cereals

loans.name: Beatice

texts.en: Beatice A. is a hairdresser who is divorced and has two children. She has been through junior high school. Beatice sells hair products as well in Takoradi. She uses her income to provide for the basic needs of her children. Beatice will use this loan to purchase more hair creams and other hair products for her salon to expand her business. With the new returns from her expanded business, Beatice plans to acquire land and use the rest to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase more hair creams and other hair products for her salon

loans.name: Lomeli

texts.es: Lomeli tiene 29 años, tiene un hijo y juntos viven en casa de sus padres. Hace mas de 2 años se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir como chalinas, guantes  y gorros, confeccionadas de lana y polar, prendas indispensables para soportar la temporada de invierno, vendiéndolos de manera ambulante en las ferias comerciales de su ciudad. Por otro lado trabaja de manera dependiente en una librería. Pero considera que el vender prendas de vestir le permite  tener más ingresos que benefician su economía. Su mayor anhelo es tener un local para su negocio. Esta es la quinta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP y sabe que éste aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de mercadería para confeccionar más prendas.
texts.en:
Lomeli is 29 years old and lives with her son at her parents’ house. For more than two years, she has been selling garments made of wool and fleece such as scarves, gloves, and caps that are needed to withstand the winter season. She sells these products as a traveling vendor at the trade fairs throughout the city. In addition to this business, Lomeli also works as a bookstore clerk. She started selling clothes so that she could have more income to help with her finances. Her greatest wish is to have a store from which to operate her business.

This is the fifth time she has received a loan from MFP. Lomeli knows the loan will be useful in advancing her business. The money she requested will be invested in the purchase of merchandise to increase her inventory of clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her inventory of clothing

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia H. is into the sale of secondhand clothes in Takoradi. She is married and has four children. Felicia has been educated up to the senior high level. Her loan will be added to her existing capital to acquire more stock of secondhand clothes to sell. She anticipates saving the new profits from her business to take care of her children's needs.

loans.use: To acquire more secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame T. is single and sells clothes in Takoradi. She has received senior high education. Maame uses her earnings to pay for her rent and utility bills. Maame will use this loan to purchase more clothes to sell to improve her business. Maame plans to add the new profits from her expanded business to her capital.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane A. is married and has two children. She has no formal education. Jane sells pegs, shaving sticks, shoe brushes, scrub brushes and other items in Takoradi. Her husband is a carpenter. Jane uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills. Jane will use this loan to purchase more goods (shoe brushes, scrub brushes) for sale. With the new revenues from her expanded business, Jane plans to save to take care of her children's needs.

loans.use: To purchase more goods (shoe brushes, scrub brushes) to sell

loans.name: Gaby

texts.es: Gaby, de 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la agricultura, principalmente siembra alfalfa que produce en sus extensiones de terreno. En esta actividad toda su familia le ayuda, y  todos aportan cuando llega el tiempo de siembra o de cosecha, y también al momento de repartir la alfalfa a sus clientes. Además, paralelamente se dedica a la crianza de ovejas que alimenta de sus cosechas de alfalfa. Después de las ventas observa que los ingresos económicos le resultan bastante rentables, es por eso que para el futuro tiene planeado continuar  extendiendo sus terrenos de cultivo.Es la 11ava vez  que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Gaby tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de abono que necesita  para sembrar más extensiones de alfalfa.
texts.en:
Gaby is 48 years old. She lives with her husband and 4 children in her own home. For 10 years, she has been working in agriculture. She mainly plants alfalfa on her land. The whole family helps with this activity and everyone pitches in when it is planting or harvesting time, and also when the alfalfa is delivered to customers. In addition, she raises sheep, which she feeds from her alfalfa harvests. After the sales, she has seen that her income has been very profitable, and that is why in the future she plans to continue expanding her crops. This is the 11th time that she has had a loan with MFP, and she promises that she will be very responsible in making her payments. In addition, she thanks all of the people who made the loan possible. It will be very useful in the progress of her business. Gaby is planning on investing the money she has asked for in purchasing fertilizer that she needs to plant more alfalfa crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer she needs for her crops

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer B. is single. She has been through junior high school. Jennifer sells clothes by going from one house to another in Takoradi. She has been selling clothes for about a year now. Jennifer uses her income to pay her rent and utility bills. She will use this loan to purchase to more clothes for resale. Jennifer plans to save the new profits from her expanded business to buy a shop.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more meat, fish and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi T. is married and has five dependants. She has been through tertiary school. She is a hairdresser at Takoradi. Her husband is a chef in a restaurant. She helps her husband take care of the family. Esi will use the loan to acquire other items like perfume, cream and hair products for her shop. With the new profits from her extended business, Esi plans to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase perfume, cream and hair products for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more groceries to fill her warehouse

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more yams

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria S. sells provisions at Takoradi.  Victoria has received a senior high education.  She is single and has a child. Victoria has been selling provisions for some time now. She is responsible for paying her rent and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more provisions for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to plow back into her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for sale.

loans.name: Cristhiam Valeska

texts.es:
Doña Cristhiam es una mujer trabajadora, con mucha iniciativa, madre de un hijo, su negocio es una ferretería que inicio con sociedad con su hermano, el cual comenzaron con ahorros y préstamo para lograr tener su propio negocio.
El cual desde hace varios años lo administra sola ya que compro la parte  a su hermano por que según el no le resultaba.
Es un trabajo cansado ya que los clientes llegan a cotizar, y se vende cada día, hay día con ventas baja pero no se deja de vender.
tiene varios trabajadores que le ayudan a despachar el zinc,perline, cemento que son trabajo para hombre, lo dificultoso es cuando no tiene para pagarles ya que las ventas se ponen bajas y todo el dinero esta invertido.
Con este préstamo invertirá en cuarenta quintales de hierro de amarre para tener en bodega ya que no tiene y no ha hecho las compras en total por falta de capital en efectivo.
Sus planes es lograr seguir aumentando su negocio ya que tiene muchos clientes a si como mucha competencia es por eso trata de tener los materiales necesario para lograr vender y poder recoger para poder pagar sus gastos.
texts.en:
Cristhiam is a hardworking woman with a lot of initiative and is the mother of one son. Her business is a hardward store, which she started with her brother. They started it with savings and a loan so that they could have their own business. She has run the business alone for several years, since she bought-out her brother who didn't think it was working out well. It is a tiring job because customers come to price goods, and she sells goods every day. There are days when sales are low, but she does not stop selling. She has some workers who help her to send out zinc, and cement, which is work for men. It is difficult when she is not able to pay them because sales are low and all the money is invested. With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of steel wire to have in store as she does not currently have any and she has not made purchases because of a lack of capital in cash. Her plan is to continue to grow her business as she has many customers but also much competition. For this reason she tries to have the necessary materials to be able to sell and collect income in order to pay her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of stell wire

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 37 años, tiene 4 hijos, juntos viven en casa de sus familiares. Hace mas de 2 años y medio tiene un puesto de venta de gaseosas y dulces, en un pequeño espacio que arrendó en un local comercial. Desde entonces brinda este servicio todos los días en la tarde. En ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, atendiendo a los clientes.  Considera que este negocio le es rentable, por eso desea mejorar su servicio, abasteciéndose de variedad de golosinas y de su puesto de venta. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, es muy responsable con sus pagos y espera concretar sus objetivos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de dulces, golosinas y gaseosas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Luisa is 37 years old and lives with her 4 children in her family’s home. For more than two and a half years she has rented a small stall in a local shopping center where she sells soft drinks and candy. Her shop is open every afternoon and some days her children help her attend to customers. Her business is profitable and so she would like to improve the service she offers by expanding her inventory to include a variety of sweets. This is Luisa’s second loan from MFP. She has been very responsible about repayment and she hopes to continue to meet her goals. She will use this loan to buy wholesale candy, sweets, and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of candy, soft drinks, and sweets

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz, de 45 años, vive en la casa de sus padres, en compañía de sus 5 hijos. Desde hace más de 3 años, se dedica a la venta de comida en las ferias comerciales y festividades realizadas  en lugares aledaños a la zona donde vive , sus hijas la ayudan a atender a los comensales , en sus ratos libres. Paralelamente a esta actividad también se dedica a la venta de quesos que lleva a la ciudad, cada 15 días, y con ambos negocios obtiene las  ganancias que le permiten sustentar la educación de sus hijos. Entre sus planes futuros tiene pensado incrementar su capital para vender mayor cantidad de  comidas, y también  quiere llevar más productos alimenticios a la ciudad.Es la quinta vez que tiene un  crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que  le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Luz tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de ingredientes no perecibles como menestras arroz, fideos, que necesita para seguir cocinando sus platillos.
texts.en:
Luz is 45 years old and lives with her 5 children in her parents’ home. For more than 3 years she has sold food at local fairs and festivals in the small villages in her area. In their spare time, her daughters help her take care of her customers. In addition to this work, every two weeks she brings cheese to the city to sell. These two activities enable her to earn enough money to cover the costs of her children’s education. Her future plans include increasing her working capital to be able to sell greater quantities of food and to be able to offer more products for sale in the city. This is Luz’s fifth loan from MFP, and she promises to be very responsible about its repayment. She is very grateful to all the people that make this loan possible, as it will be very useful for the success of her business. Margarita plans to invest the loan in the purchase of non-perishable items such as rice, noodles, and other ingredients that she needs for the food that she sells.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for her business

loans.name: Capullo Balnco Group

texts.es:
El bancomunal Capullo Blanco, inicia su ciclo 37 con 20 socias que pertenecen al departamento D. Huancavelica.
Modesta, es socia del Banco comunal, este ciclo esta apoyando en la Junta Directiva en el cargo D. Tesorera. Modesta es casada y tiene 03 hijos D. 14, 13 y 10 años, todos actualmente estudian en la escuela D. la Comunidad. 
Modesta se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, negocio que empezó por necesidad al tener que apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, Modesta empezó a vender sus golosinas usando una pequeña  fuente donD. colocaba sus productos, gracias a sus préstamos a podido hacer que su negocio crezca.  Modesta, requiere un préstamo para seguir invirtiendo e incrementando su negocio, su meta es poder abrir una bodega en su casa, para lo cual esta trabajando.
texts.en:
The Capullo Blanco community bank started its 37th cycle with 20 members from the Huancavelica department. Modesta is a member, and this cycle she is helping in the Board in the role of Treasurer. Modesta is married and has 3 children ages 14, 13 and 10, all of whom are currently studying in the community school. Modesta sells candy, a business which she started out of the necessity to help her husband with the household costs. Modesta started selling her candy using a small dish to hold her products, and thanks to her loans she has been able to make her business grow. Modesta is requesting a loan to continue investing in and expanding her business. Her goal is to be able to open a store in her home, and she is working toward this.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Candies, cookies and caramels

loans.name: Zulema

texts.es: Zulema, de 39 años, vive en la casa de sus padres.Desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la preparación de pasteles  y queques que vende  a sus clientes fijos. Sus pasteles son elaborados con ingredientes de calidad que garantizan su buen sabor, y tienen mucha demanda, es por esta razón, que se siente muy satisfecha con las ganancias que obtiene. Sus ventas las realiza generalmente por las mañanas; y por las tardes se dedica a comprar los ingredientes que necesita. Este negocio le ha generado buenas ganancias económicas que necesitaba, y aunque una de sus dificultades era que no tiene un horno disponible, ya que arrienda uno de un familiar, seguirá trabajando para concretar su deseo de llegar a  tener su propio horno.Es la cuarta oportunidad que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Zulema tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de harina, y también adquirirá  otros  ingredientes, al por mayor,  que necesita para seguir preparando sus pasteles.
texts.en:
Zulema, 39, lives in her parents' home. For 4 years she has made cakes and queques [Peruvian cake with orange juice] which she sells to her regular customers. Her cakes are made with quality ingredients that guarantee a good flavour. She has a lot of demand, and so she is very satisfied with the earnings she obtains. She usually makes her sales in the mornings; and in the afternoons she buys the ingredients she needs. This business has generated her the good income that she needs, although one of her difficulties is not having an available oven, as she rents one from a family member. She will continue working to achieve her goal of having her own oven. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with the payment of her quotas. She also thanks everyone who is making this loan possible; it will be very useful in the progress of her business. Zuelma plans to invest the requested money in the purchase of flour, and she will also acquire other wholesale ingredients that she needs for her cakes.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Dora

texts.es: Dora tiene 53 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y con el menor D. sus 5 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace más D. 30 años se dedica a la agricultura, sembrando papa, maíz y alfalfa. Es así que desD. que siembra espera un periodo largo, dándoles los cuidados necesarios D. sus tierras, para que la cosecha sea muy productiva y pueda rápidamente ser comercializada en el mercado. Toda la familia participa D. manera activa en esta labor, ya que las ganancias que reciben son en beneficio D. todos sus hijos. Paralelamente a esta actividad, tiene una fábrica D. ladrillos, en donD. su esposo se encarga D. este trabajo. Dora manifiesta que ha tenido momentos duros en la agricultura, pero no desanima, es mas continuara sembrando en sus terrenos y mejorar con el tiempo. Es la tercera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que promete será muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra D. sacos D. abono, asimismo desea comprar  ramas D. leña para su elaborar ladrillos.
texts.en:
Dora is 53 and shares her life with her husband and the youngest of their 5 children; they live together in their own home. For over 30 years she has worked in agriculture, sowing potatoes, corn and alfalfa. Thus, after she sows she waits for a long period of time, giving the necessary care to her land, so that the harvest will be very productive and will sell quickly in the market. The whole family actively participates in this work, as the income is beneficial to all of the children. She also has a brick factory, where her husband is in charge of the work. Dora says that there have been difficult moments in farming, but she is not discouraged, and she will continue to sow in her land and improve with time. This is her third loan with MFP, and so she promises to be very responsible with her payments. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of bags of fertilizer. She also wants to buy bushels of firewood for brick-making.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
En la Ciudad de Carapeguá  en la Compañía Espartillar distante a 7 km de la oficina de Carapeguá unas señoras de escasos recursos se enteraron del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron reunirse para trabajar en conjunto.
 Estas Señoras son activas muy trabajadoras y se dedican a las  actividades de artesanía ya que son de zona donde la mayoría de las personas se dedican a la artesanía.
Necesitan de esta operación crediticia para invertir en sus respectivos trabajos y así poder lograr un crecimiento sostenible que les haga crecer como grupo y en forma individual así como la Señora Natividad quien necesita el crédito para la compra de hilos y telas de varios colores y tipos. 
La señora Natividad se dedica a la artesanía desde muy joven se dedica a esta actividad ya que su heredo esta actividad de su familia.
Ella elabora su artesanía y su marido quien decepciona los pedidos y los lleva para la venta hasta los clientes.
texts.en:
In the city of Carapeguá, in the Compañía Espartillar, seven miles from the office of Carapeguá, some Señoras of modest means, joined the group "Committee of Women Entrepreneurs" and decided to work together. These Señoras are hard-workers who make crafts for a living since they are from an areas where most people do craftwork. They need loans to invest in their respective work. This way they will be able to grow their businesses, which will help them grow as a group, and as individuals. Like Señora Natividad who needs a loan to buy thread and fabric of various types and colors. Señora Natividad has done craftwork since she was very young and continues doing it since she inherited this work from her family. She does the craftwork while her husband takes the orders, sells it, and brings it to the customers.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials for craftwork like varous types and colors of thread and fabric.

loans.name: Mi Bankito ( Cuenca ) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mi Bankito esta formado por 11 socias que luchan día a día en sus trabajos para salir adelante y así crecer conjuntamente con su familia, viven en la comunidad del Aguacate, en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza arquitectónica, su gente, su cultura, su gastronomía.

La Señora Fanny León vive en la comunidad de Guagunchi perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle, se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, fue invitada por su hermana ha formar parte de este bankito de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, se dedica a trabajar en el taller  de su propiedad, lleva trabajando 10 años en su negocio laborando de 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., se dedica a la confección de jeans, trabaja con empleados quienes le colaboran para crecer en su negocio.

Nuestra socia tiene 36 años de edad, casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 3 hijos quienes tienen 16, 13 y 10 años de edad, su primer hijo se ha retirado del colegio por unos problemas que ha tenido pero este año de nuevo va a reingresar, su segundo hijo se encuentra estudiando en el colegio, y su última hija estudia en la escuela, su esposo trabaja en el taller de la familia, gracias al trabajo en conjunto han logrado construir su casa propia, con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela y materiales para su taller, su meta es seguir creciendo en su taller.

La Señora Gladis A. vive en la comunidad del Aguacate, tiene 40 años de edad, casada, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes ahora se encuentra de 20, 19, 18, 17 años de edad, su primer hijo estudio en la universidad, su segunda hija ha tenido que retirarse de sus estudio por quedar embarazada  y ahora vive en unión libre, su tercer hijo es casado y vive de manera independiente, su último hijo estudia en el colegio, su esposo es chofer de grúas, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica al arreglo de una casa en la cual va 8 años trabaja solo el medio día ya que el resto del tiempo se dedica al cuidado de un niño, también hay veces que se da  tiempo para lavar ropa de otras personas. Se encuentra en su segundo ciclo, antes a pertenecido a otro grupo en la banca comunal y los créditos le han beneficiado para la estabilidad económica de su hogar, por las facilidades en el pago. Con su nuevo crédito lo va pagar  una letra de la computadora que adquirido para el estudio de sus hijos, su meta es de llegar a tener un negocio propio para no depender de otra persona.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Mi Bankito” (My Little Bank) consists of eleven members who struggle day after day in their jobs so that they can get ahead and grow alongside their families. They live in the community of Aguacate in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful architecture, its people, its culture, and its cuisine.

Sra. Fanny León lives in the community of Guagunchi, which is part of El Valle Parish. She is participating in her second loan cycle. Fanny was invited by her sister to become part of this Communal Bank made up of determined and enterprising women. She has has been operating her own workshop for ten years. Fanny works from 8am until 6pm making jeans. She has employees who work for her and help grow her business.

Fanny is 36 years old, married, and has three children (ages 16, 13, and 10) that resulted from her relationship with her husband. Her oldest child dropped out of high school because of a few problems, but he plans to return next year. The second child currently attends high school and her youngest daughter is in elementary school. Her husband works in the family business. Thanks to their mutual efforts, they were able to build their own home. With her new loan, Fanny plans to buy fabric and materials for her workshop. Her goal is to continue growing her business.

Sra. Gladis A. lives in the community of Aguacate. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children who are currently 20, 19, 18, and 17 years of age. Her oldest child attends the university. Her second daughter had to quit school after she became pregnant and is now in a common law marriage. Her third child is married and lives independently. The youngest child is a high school student. Her husband works as a crane operator. As a result of both of their jobs, they were able to build their own home.

Gladis has worked the past eight years providing housekeeping services at a residence. She only works half a day and spends the rest of the time caring for her child. There are times when she also does laundry for other people. Gladis is participating in her second loan cycle and was previously part of another Communal Bank group. The loans have been a great benefit because they have provided financial stability to her household and the payments are simple to make. Her new loan will be used to pay the bill for the computer that she acquired to help with her children’s studies. Gladis hopes to have her own business so that she does not have to depend on other people.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, zippers, buttons, and thread for making jeans

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes Pérez, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en el Municipio de Guatajiagua  del departamento de Morazán, Ella es madre soltera, vive con su madre y sus dos hijos Denis, Kevin de 15 y 10 años respectivos, se dedica a la alfarería fábrica comales.
Aprendió a elaborar comales a la edad de 14 años, su madre es quien le enseño este oficio, actualmente comercializa sus comales en el mercado Municipal de Guatajiagua y con visitantes del lugar, Mercedes es una persona muy alegre, que le gusta mucho su trabajo y hace excelentes comales y ollas,con los ingresos apoya sus hijos con los estudios y solvena algunas necesidades familiares. Actualmente necesita un prestamo para la compra de materia prima ( Barro de Diferentes Clases)para la elaboracion de sus comales. 

Sus aspiraciones son  tener una variedad de productos artesanales para sus clientes, que sus hijos terminen los estudios, a seguir con su trabajo, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes Pérez, 39, lives in the town of Guatajiagua, in the Morazan department. She is a single mother and lives with her mother and two children: Denis and Kevin, ages 15 and 10 respectively. She is a potter and makes comales [clay dishes for making tortillas]. She learned to make comales at the age of 14; her mother taught her. She now sells her comales in the municipal market of Guatajiagua and to visitors in the area. Mercedes is a very happy woman who loves her work and makes excellent comales and pots. With her income she supports her sons with their studies and covers family necessities. She now needs a loan for the purchase of basic materials (different kinds of clay) to make her comales. Her aspirations are to have a variety of handcrafted products for her customers; for her sons to finish their studies; and to continue with her work, improving her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Different types of clay

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María Concepción A. P., tiene 37 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera, departamento de Morazán, es casada y vive con sus cuatro hijos  Héctor, Dani, Emely, de las edades de 11, 13, 15 y 18 respectivamente, ella tienes una tienda donde vende productos de la canasta básica.
El negocio lo empezó hace cinco años, cuando vio que no había una tienda cercana, decidió comenzar a invertir sus ahorros y con ayuda de su esposo, emprendió su negocio donde comercializa productos como arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, azúcar, jabón, desinfectantes y otros productos de primera necesidad.
María es una persona responsable y trabajadora que gracias a su esfuerzo a logrado manejar bien su tienda, actualmente ella se ha visto en la necesidad de adquirir un préstamo para invertirlo en compra de artículos y tener variedad de productos en su tienda, ella quiere comprar al mayoreo a un precio más bajo (arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, azúcar, jabón, desinfectantes), aumentar las ventas.
Sus aspiraciones de negocio es tener una tienda surtida para poder aumentar sus ganancias y apoyar a sus hijos que están estudiando, y que ellos puedan lograr ser personas profesionales, ya que ella no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
María Concepción A. P., 37, lives in San Francisco Gotera, in the Morazan department. She is married and lives with her four children: Hector, Dani, Emely, ages 11, 13, 15 and 18 respectively. She has a store where she sells basic staples. She started her business five years ago: when she saw that there was no store nearby, she decided to start to invest her savings and with her husband's help she launched this business where she sells products such as rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, ham, disinfectants and other basic needs products. Maria is a responsible and hard-working person who, thanks to her hard work, has achieved good management of her store. She now finds it necessary to acquire a loan to invest in the purchase of products to have a variety of products in her store. She wants to buy wholesale at a lower price (rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, ham, disinfectants) to increase her sales. Her aspirations are to have a well-stocked store to increase her earnings and support her children who are studying; and for them to become professionals, since she did not have the opportunity to study.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, ham, disinfectants and other items

loans.name: Yessica Del Carmen

texts.es:
