Yessica del Carmen, tiene 21 años de edad, reside en San Francisco Gotera departamento de Morazán, es soltera vive con su mamá, está estudiando y se dedica a la venta de de antojitos elaborados a base de plano, leche y azúcar.
Desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de empanadas ( de plano, leche y azúcar), ella las comercializa en su casa y algunas veces a lugares secanos de donde reside, con el dinero que ella obtiene ha logrado mantener su negocio, solventar  gastos de estudios, algunas necesidades personales y familiares.
Yessica es una joven exitosa con su negocio, responsable y alegre, con deseo de superarse por eso ella continua sus estudios a base de su propio esfuerzo, actualmente ella necesita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de sus empanadas, ella compraría (azúcar, plátanos, aceite, leña y gas), esto contribuirá a continuar con su  venta, generar los ingreso para sus estudios y gastos de su familia.
Ella sueña con terminar su tercer año de Bachillerato a distancia (sábados y Domingos recibe clases), diversificar sus productos de antojitos y mejorar así la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Yessica del Carmen Gutiérrez F. is 21-years-old and lives in San Francisco Gotera in the department of Morazán. She's single and lives with her mother. She's studying and sells homemade snack foods made out of plantains, milk, and sugar. She's been selling her empanadas (of plantains, milk, and sugar) for three years. She sells them in her house and sometimes in places around where she lives. With the money that she earns she's managed to maintain her business, pay her education expenses, and some personal and familial expenses. Yessica is a successful young businesswoman; she's responsible and cheerful with a desire to excel. For this reason she continues her studies while supporting herself. Currently she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of ingredients for her empanadas. She will buy sugar, plantains, oil, firewood, and gas. This will help her continue her sales and generate income for her studies and the expenses of her family. She dreams of finishing her third year higher-level distance learning (she takes classes on Saturdays and Sundays), diversifying her snack food products, and improving her and her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar, plantains, oil, firewood, and gas

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 47 años, comparte su vida con su esposo y sus 3 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace mas de 12 años se dedica a vender comida, en un local que arrendó junto con su hermana, quien también se dedica en esta actividad. Desde entonces juntas preparan sus platillos y atienden a su más exigente clientela, siendo la mayoría, conductores de una empresa de transportes. Edith disfruta mucho de su trabajo, ya que le gusta cocinar, es por ello que su sazón son del gusto de sus comensales. Las ganancias que recibe son satisfactorias es por ello que desea seguir creciendo más en su negocio. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a ser muy responsables con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de nuevas mesas sillas, cubiertos y manteles para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Edith, age 47, shares her life with her husband and their three children. They live together in their own house. For over 12 years she has been selling food in a rented place. She does this with her sister, who also sells food. They prepare their dishes and wait on their most demanding customers. Most of her customers are drivers for transportation companies. Edith really enjoys her work because she likes to cook. Her diners like her seasoning. The income that she gets is satisfactory. That is why she wishes to continue growing in her business. This is her eleventh loan with MFP. She pledges to be very responsible with her payments. She will use the requested loan to buy new tables and chairs, cutlery, and tablecloths in order to give her customers better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new tables and chairs, cutlery, and tablecloths

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 62 años,  es casado y vive con el menor de sus 6 hijos, en su casa que es propia.Desde hace más de 20 años, se dedica a la agricultura, antes se dedicaba a enseñar pues su profesión es la de profesor, pero tras sus años de haberse jubilado, busco un oficio mas tranquilo. En la actualidad es mas intensa su dedicación por las tareas de campo, y generalmente invierte su dinero en sembrar alfalfa y maíz. Después  arrienda sus tierras a sus clientes, que son comerciantes de alfalfa, es así que sus ganancias le permiten seguir sosteniendo su economía y además  tiene planes de mejorar y ampliar  sus cultivos.Es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP,  y promete que será muy responsable con sus pagos, y agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Antonio tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de varios sacos de abono que necesita para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Antonio, age 62, is married and lives with the youngest of their six children. They live in their own house. He has been a farmer for over 20 years. He taught before that; he is a teacher by profession. In his retirement he looked for a more tranquil job. His job is now more intense because of the field work. He generally invests his money in planting alfalfa and corn. He later rents his fields to his customers, who are alfalfa merchants. That is the way that his earnings allow him to keep supporting his family. He also has plans to improve and expand his crops. This is his first loan with MFP. He pledges to be very responsible with his payments. He is grateful to the people who made this loan possible. It will be very useful to the progress of his business. Antonio plans to use the requested money to buy several sacks of fertilizer that his crops need.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Erika Marjori

texts.es:
Erika Morjori R. A., tiene 26 años de edad, reside en San francisco Gotera del departamento de Usulután, vive con su esposo y cuatro hijos Marjori, Cesar, Luis, de 10, 6, 4 años de edad y Alex 8 meses de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de Hamburguesas y panes con salchicha.
Ella anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de ropa en lugares afuera Gotera, por la inseguridad decidió buscar un lugar en la ciudad, emprendió un nuevo negocio actualmente ella con sus ahorros tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal de Gotera donde comercializa Hamburguesa y hot dog, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que gracias a su esfuerzos saca adelante a su familia.
Erika necesita un préstamo para comprar una hiela y productos para hacer refresco, el dinero le ayudara a tener más ventas, ofrecer un mejor servicios a sus clientes y mejorar el estilo de vida de su familia. Ella sueña con establecer un negocio grande de comida, para poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Erika Morjori R. A., is 26, and lives in San Fransisco Gotera in the department of Usulutan with her husband and four children. Her children are Marjori, Cesar, Luis, ages 10, 6 and 4 respectively, and Alex of 8 months. She makes a living selling hamburgers and hot dogs. She used to sell clothing outside Gotera, but due to the crime levels she decided to find a place in the city. She started a new business with her savings and currently has a stand in the Gotera municipal market selling hamburgers and hot dogs. She is a hardworking and responsible person that maintains her family through great effort. Erika needs a loan to buy a cooler and goods to make fresh juice. The loan will help her increase her sales, offer better service to her customers and improve her family's lifestyle. She dreams of having a larger restaurant business to help her children with their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a cooler to serve cold natural beverages

loans.name: Veronica Del Carmen

texts.es:
Verónica del Carmen Martínez P., tiene 19 años de edad, reside en Concepción Batres, departamento de Usulután, está acompañada y tiene un hijo de dos años de edad, viven en casa de sus padres, tiene una granja de pollos.
 Hace tres años se dedica a la crianza de gallinas rojas y comercializa huevos, ella comenzó su negocio gracias a la ayuda de una amiga quien le apoyo, de este trabajo ella ha logrado reunir dinero para mantener 300 gallinas; los gastos de mantenimiento son elevados por lo que decidió solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de material para reparar la galera de las gallinas.
Verónica es una persona muy trabajadora y que lucha por mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo y su familia, sueña con tener su propia casa donde pueda vivir con su familia, además desea ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Verónica del Carmen Martínez P. is 19 years old and lives in Concepción Batres, in the department of Usulután. She and her partner have a 2-year old son. Verónica lives in her parents' house and owns a chicken farm. She has been raising red hens and selling their eggs for 3 years. She began this business with the help of a friend, and has made enough money to keep a flock of 300 hens. Her maintenance costs have been high, so she decided to request a loan to repair her chicken coop. Verónica is a hardworking person who struggles to improve the quality of life of her child and family. She dreams of having her own home and of expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to repair her chicken coop.

loans.name: Federico  Ramón

texts.es:
El Sr. Federico es de la compañía Calixtro de la ciudad de Carapeguá, cuenta con casa propia, y tiene un hijo.

 El cliente se dedica la zapatería hace más de cinco años, cuenta con clientela formada. Gracias a esta actividad pudo concretar muchos proyectos como la construcción de su casa y el mantener  a su familia. 

 Accedió a un crédito con nuestra entidad que lo utilizó para la compra de materia prima para la producción de calzados(cuero, tinta y clavos) y de esta forma aumentar su nivel de ingreso.
texts.en:
Federico lives in Calixtro in Carapeguá city. He has 1 son and owns his home. He has been a cobbler for more than 5 years and has a loyal customer base. Thanks to his work, he has been able to accomplish many things, like taking care of his family and building his home. Federico obtained a loan from our institution and used it to purchase raw materials for making shoes (leather, dye and nails), which has allowed him to increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of leather, shoe paint, and shoe nails.

loans.name: Martha Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Martha de 56 años, vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, es madre divorciada. Ella vende almuerzos todos los días y es su principal ingreso económico para mantenerse. 

Martha vende almuerzos desde hace años desde que se fue al exterior y la dejo sula con sus hijos. Desde ese tiempo hasta que sus hijos crecieron ha trabajado vendiendo almuerzos sola desde las 08h00am hasta las 13h30pm todos los días. Los almuerzos los hace en su casa y los vende ya a sus clientes conocidos. 

Para poder tener mas ingresos y hacer mas almuerzos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites y bebidas. En el futuro quiere tener su propio local y tener hay su propio restaurante.
texts.en:
Martha, 56, lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. She is a divorced mother. She sells lunches every day; this is the main way she generates income to support herself. Martha has sold lunches for a numbers of years, ever since her husband left the country and left her alone with their children. From that time until their children grew she has worked alone selling lunches from 8am until 1:30pm every day. She makes the lunches in her home, and sells them to her established customers. In order to have more income and make more lunches, she wants to use the loan to buy rice, cooking oil and drinks. In the future she wants to have her own business premises where she can have her own restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy rice, cooking oil and drinks

loans.name: Test

texts.fr: حالياً، يعد موقع الإنترنت الخاص بـ Kiva من أكثر مواقع تقديم القروض المصغرة زيارة على مستوى العالم، كما أنه في طريقه ليُصبح من أكبر مواقع التمويل بقروض مصغرة حول العالم. حيث تتيح شركة Kiva للممولين من الأفراد إقراض الأفراد في مختلف أنحاء العالم. ولتسهيل هذه العملية، فإن شركاء Kiva من مؤسسات التمويل المصغر ذات السمعة العالية (MFI) – يتم تسميتهم بشركاء المجال في Kiva. بالنسبة لمؤسسات التمويل المصغر (MFI)، توفر Kiva بيئة عمل لرفع التكلفة المنخفضة ورأس مال القرض قصير المدة بشكل مباشر من المُمولين الأفراد حول العالم، وذلك لعرض أعمالهم على الجمهور العالمي.
texts.en:
testing

Translated from French by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: على رأس مال القرض قصير المدة

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es: Eliza tiene 60 años, es viuda y vive con una D. sus hijas y sus 2 nietos en su casa propia. Casi toda su vida se ha dedicado a la siembra y cosecha D. papa y maíz; actividad que le genera ganancias, ya que una vez cosechados sus productos, los lleva a vender a la ciudad mas cercana a su zona. Paralelamente a este trabajo, cría pollos en su granja, dedicándole todos los días, solo los fines D. semana los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos o clientes, quienes saben D. la dedicación con que cría y alimenta a estos animales. Eliza desea seguir dedicándose a las tareas agrícolas  hasta donD. tenga fuerzas. Este es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por tanto se compromete a ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Comprará 2 sacos D. abono, así como ovejas para aumentar la cantidad D. animales, ya que este negocio más rentable.
texts.en:
Eliza is 60 years old and a widow; she lives with one of her daughters and 2 grandchildren in a house that she owns. Almost all her life she has farmed potatoes and maize to earn a living. After harvest, she brings her crops to sell in the city closest to her home. Along with this work, Eliza raises chickens, which she tends to everyday. On the weekends she sells to her neighbors and other customers, who know how dedicated she is to caring for and feeding her animals. Eliza wishes to continue farming for as long as she has the strength to. This is her second loan with MFP, therefore she promises to be very responsible in her repayment of the loan. Eliza will buy 2 sacks of fertilizer, as well as sheep to expand her farm, since raising sheep is a more profitable business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 sacks of fertilizer and sheep.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 45 años, es viuda y vive con sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace 17 años realiza las tareas agrícolas con ayuda de sus hijos, desde que eran muy pequeños. Con el tiempo han solidificado sus esfuerzos, hoy tiene varias cabezas de animales entre vacuno y ovino, además cuenta con algunos terrenos donde cultiva hortalizas y papa. Es así que todos los días sale a vender leche de sus vacas y también revisa que sus terrenos de cultivo estén desarrollando de manera saludable, solo espera la cosecha para llevarla en los próximos meses al mercado de su  ciudad. Ella anhela seguir creciendo y mejorando la calidad de su ganado. Este es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser cumplido con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará toros y vacas.
texts.en:
Flor, 45, is a widow and lives with her 3 children in her own home. She has worked in agriculture for 17 years. Her children have helped her from the time that they were very young. Over time she has consolidated her efforts. Now she has a number of animals, both cattle and sheep. In addition, she has some land where she cultivates vegetables and potatoes. Each day she leaves to sell the milk from her cows, and she also inspects her lands under cultivation to make sure that they are developing favorably. She awaits the harvest, when she will take her products over the next few months to the market in the city. She hopes to continue growing and improving the quality of her livestock. This is the second time that she has taken a loan from MFP, and she pledges to comply with the terms of her payments. With the loan she requests, she will buy bulls and cows.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bulls and cows

loans.name: Juana Pabla

texts.es:
La Sra. Juana tiene un comercio que se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos generales, ella hace un año que abrió su negocio, ya que anteriormente trabajaba como vendedora en una empresa que se dedica a la ventas de zapatos, ella es soltera con un hijo en edad escolar.
 Con un poco de su ahorro pudo montar su negocio y se   independizo.
 Ella  necesita de este crédito para la compra de mas mercadería para su tienda como, prendas de vestir para hombre y mujer, ya que cuenta con buena cantidad de clientes quienes diariamente acuden hasta su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana has a business buying and selling general items. She opened her store a year ago, since she previously worked as a sales clerk in a shoe store. She is single and has one school-age son. With a little of her savings, Juana opened her business and became independent. She needs this loan to purchase more merchandise, like men's and women's clothing, since she has a good number of customers who come to her store daily.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise for clothing store

loans.name: Midori

texts.es: Midori, de 41 años, vive con su esposo y  sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 1 año atiende en su negocio de venta de abarrotes ubicado en su casa. Se dio cuenta que en el lugar por donde vive no había muchas tiendas que abastezcan de comestibles a los vecinos, así empezó con el negocio. Y durante los fines de semana se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado vacuno y también  los vende sacrificados, cuya carne la comercializa  en su tienda. En la actualidad  ha percibido los frutos  beneficiosos en sus rentas por lo que  esta pensando en  incrementar  su capital de trabajo con mayor cantidad de  mercadería.Es la 16ava vez  que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será  muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, pues le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Midori tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado  en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería en comestibles que le permitirá  abastecer  su tienda.
texts.en:
Midori, is 41 and lives with her husband and 3 children in their own home. A year ago she started a business selling groceries from her home. She realized that there weren't many stores in the area selling groceries to the neighbors, so she started the business. On weekends she also spends time buying and selling cattle, including butchered meat which she sells in her store. So far she has been profitable and is considering increasing her operating capital with more inventory. This is the 16th loan she has had through MFP and promises to be very responsible with her payments. Additionally she is thankful to everyone who made the loan possible as it will be quite useful in growing her business. Midori plans to invest the money requested in more food inventory to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase edible goods for sale in her store

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose C. T.  es un señor de 54 años de edad el  cual vive  con su esposa en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico,  ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; reconocida como una comunidad amiga de la tranquilidad  y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería  y turismo. 

Don José  se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de Hortalizas como Banano, plátano pero sobretodo ñampi. Dice que el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a la venta de sus productos  sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.
En estos momentos Don José desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢300,000 (trescientos  mil colones), para comprar el abono que necesita para su terreno. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha de ñampi, ya que asegura que la próxima cosecha será para exportación.
José forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socio ha recibido ya  dos microcréditos con los que ha podido desarrollarse como empresario de una manera exitosa
texts.en:
Jose C. T. is a 54-year-old man who lives with his wife in a rural Costa Rican community called Abanico, located in San Isidro de Penas Blancas, San Ramon, in the province of Alajuela. It is known as a friendly, peaceful community dedicated to productive activities such as agriculture, livestock and tourism. Jose is in agriculture, specifically the planting of foods such as bananas and plantains, but mostly ñampi [a vegetable in the sweet potato family]. He says that the market for this produce is very good. He comments that thanks to the sales of his products his living conditions have improved considerably and he has grown as a person and acquired much knowledge. Now Jose wants to obtain a microloan of 300,000 colones to buy the fertilizer that he needs for his land. With this investment he hopes to achieve a good ñampi harvest, as the next harvest will be exported. Jose is part of the Credito Communal de Abanico Group, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. As such he has already recieved two microloans with which he has been able to develop successfully as a businessman.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Magali

texts.es: Magali tiene 27 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en casa de sus padres. Hace mas de 6 años se dedica a vender comida, en un local que arrendó con su hermana, desde ese momento preparan desayuno y almuerzo, siendo sus clientes los conductores de una empresa de transportes. Magali, considera esta actividad muy rentable, además la buena atención que da a sus clientes le ha dado ventaja en las ventas, así como el gusto que tiene para cocinar. Por tanto su objetivo es tener un puesto en un lugar más céntrico y comercial de la ciudad. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por tanto asegura que será muy cumplida con las cuotas pendientes. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.
texts.en:
Magali, 27, lives with her husband and two children in her parents' home. For over 6 years she has sold food in a shop that she leases with her sister. They prepare breakfast and lunch, since their customers are drivers for a transportation company. Magali considers this activity to be very profitable, and her good customer service and love of cooking have given her a sales advantage. Therefore, her goal is to have a spot in a more central and commercial area of the city. This is her fourth loan with MFP, and so she will be very punctual with the repayments. With the requested loan, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients for the preparation of her food.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria, de 56 años, vive con su hija en su casa que es propia. Desde muy pequeña observo como se realizaban  las tareas agrícolas,  y luego  decidió que esta seria la mejor manera de  generarse ingresos. En la actualidad se dedica a la agricultura, siembra productos de su zona como papa, maíz, trigo, alverja, cebolla entre otros. Luego vende su cosecha, al por mayor o la lleva  al mercado, y obtiene regulares ganancias. Su hija siempre le ayuda en su labor  y en todo lo que se requiera para la siembra y cosecha, también  contrata a peones para los que le ayuden en las faenas agrícolas. 

Paralelamente se dedica a la  crianza de  animales que compra y vende todos los fines de semana en la feria ganadera de su localidad. Tiene pensado aumentar la cantidad de animales que tiene, para que su capital sea mayor. Es la  segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y promete que será muy responsable en el pago de sus cuotas, además agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Gloria tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono, para sus cultivos y también comprará 2 toros pequeños.
texts.en:
Gloria, 56, lives with her daughter in their own home. She has done farm chores since she was very young, and later she decided that this would be the best way to generate an income. She now farms, sowing local products such as potatoes, corn, wheat, peas, and onion among others. Later she sells her harvest wholesale or brings it to the market, and obtains a regular income. Her daughter always helps her with her work, and with everything that is needed for sowing and harvesting. She also hires laborers to help her with the farm work. She also raises animals which she buys and sells every weekend at the livestock fair in her area. Gloria plans to increase the quantity of animals she has, so that she will have more capital. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. She also thanks everyone who are making this loan possible; it will be very useful in the progress of her business. Gloria plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of various bags of fertilizer, for her crops, and she will also buy 2 small bulls.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fertilizer and 2 small bulls

loans.name: Rosibeth

texts.es:
Rosibeth C. A.  es una señora de 45 años de edad, quien vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico, ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; la que es conocida como una comunidad muy tranquila y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Doña Rosibeth tiene un pequeño terreno en el cual ha sembrado diferentes cultivos tales como papaya y plátano, pero en esta ocasión desea iniciar un nuevo proyecto en una hectárea de terreno que le heredo su padre para sembrar ñampí, un tubérculo de agradable sabor, rico en nutrientes, de procesamiento agroindustrial amplio y de gran demanda tanto en Costa Rica como en otros países.

Actualmente doña Rosi está solicitando un préstamo de ¢500,000 (quinientos mil colones)  para ayudarse con la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del ñampí. 

Rosibeth forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico; una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socia ha recibido 2 microcrédito que le ha permitido tener un ingreso que le permita tener una mejor calidad de Vida.
texts.en:
Rosibeth C. A. is a 45-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in a rural Costa Rican neighbourhood named Abanico, located in San Isidro de Penas Blancas, San Ramon, in the Alajuela province. It is known as a very peaceful community dedicated to productive activities such as agriculture, livestock and tourism. Rosibeth has a small plot of land in which she has sown different crops such as papaya and plantanes, but she now wants to start a new project in a hectare of land that she inherited from her father to plant ñampí, a tuber with a pleasant flavour, rich in nutrients, widely grown and in great demand in Costa Rica and other countries. Rosi is requesting a loan of 500,000 colones to help her with the preparation of the soil, the purchase of seeds, fertilizers and other materials that will be necessary to guarantee the optimal growth of the ñampí. Rosibeth is part of the Credito Communal de Abanico Group; one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member, she has recieved 2 microloans which have allowed her to have an income that has given her a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Soil preparation, purchase of seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
Marlene Sánchez Quiroz  es una señora de 42 años de edad la cual vive  con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico,  ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; reconocida como una comunidad amiga de la tranquilidad  y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería  y turismo. 

Desde hace varios  años Marlene  se dedica a la cría de pollos para engorde y gallinas ponedoras para la producción de carne y huevos, ella vende sus productos a los vecinos de su comunidad los cuales se muestran muy satisfechos.  Dice que tener el apoyo y la ayuda de su esposo le facilita seguir con el proyecto. Además dice que el proyecto le es muy interesante   ya que ha visto como poco a poco su negocio crece y la demanda cada vez es más fuerte.
 Actualmente Marlene está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢629.000 (seiscientos veinte  nueve mil colones) para la compra de más pollos y gallinas; concentrado, y productos para el tratamiento de enfermedades; además de ampliar y reforzar su local. Con esto ella espera hacer crecer más su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia.

Marlene  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer Crédito y manifiesta que esta muy contenta y agradecida por la oportunidad de desarrollo que le brinda las ECC  a la comunidad y a ella.
texts.en:
Marlene Sánchez Quiroz is a 42-year-old woman who lives with her husband and 4 children, in a rural Costa Rican community called Abanico, located in San Isidro de Penas Blancas, San Ramon, in the Alajuela province. It is known as a friendly and peaceful community dedicated to productive activities such as agriculture, livestock and tourism. For several years Marlene has raised chickens to fatten them up, and laying hens for meat and egg production. She sells her products to her neighbours, who are very satisfied. She says that having the support and help of her husband has helped her to continue with this project. She also says that this work is very interesting since she has seen her business grow little by little and the demand is greater every time. Marlene is now requesting a microloan of 629 000 colones for the purchase of more chickens and hens; concentrate and products for the treatment of illnesses; and also to expand and reinforce her location. With this, she hopes to make her business grow more and to improve her quality of life. Her business is going well but a lack of money has stopped its further growth. With the requested loan she hopes to increase her sales and to thus improve her family's economic condition. Marlene is part of the Credito Communal de Abanico Group, one of the 100 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her first loan and she says that she is very happy and grateful for the development opportunity offered by these groups to her and her community.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Chickens, food, pens

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María Rosa Q. H. es una señora de 53  años de edad la cual vive  con su esposo y sus 2hijas en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Abanico,  ubicada en San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Provincia de Alajuela; reconocida como una comunidad amiga de la tranquilidad  y dedicada a actividades productivas tales como la agricultura, ganadería  y turismo. 

María Rosa es parte de un grupo de empresarias llamadas GEMA, ella se dedica a la siembra de Tilo, una planta medicinal. Su producto es comprado por una Empresa Costarricense muy conocidas llamada “Manza-te” que se especializa en la venta de te derivado de plantas medicinales costarricenses.

Desde hace más de 10 años doña María se dedica a la producción de tilo, la cual le ha traído grandes beneficios  tanto a ella como a su familia, dice que se ha esforzado mucho y a puesto mucho empeño para que el proyecto salga adelante. 

Doña María dice que la demanda en el mercado por este producto es muy alta, por lo que desea ampliar su plantación de tilo y mantener la calidad. Es por eso que ella necesita un préstamo de ¢500.000 (quinientos  mil colones)  para ayudarse con  la preparación del suelo, compra de semillas, fertilizantes, entre otros insumos que sean necesarios para garantizar la siembra óptima del tilo y además espera comprar: madera, plástico, clavos, maya etc; todos estos materiales necesarios para ampliar el secador.

Ella  forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socia ha recibido un microcrédito, el cual le  ha permitido desarrollarse como microempresaria y mejorar la calidad de vida  de sus Hijos.
texts.en:
María Rosa Q. H. is a 53 year old woman. She lives with her husband and 2 children in a rural community in Costa Rica called Abanico, located in San Isidro de Peñas Blancas, San Ramón, Alajuela Province. It is known as a peace-loving community dedicated to activities such as agriculture, livestock farming and tourism. María Rosa is part of a group of business women called GEMA. She grows tilo (also known as carpenter's bush), a medicinal plant. She sells her product to a very well-known Costa Rican company called "Manza-te" that specializes in the sale of tea made from medicinal Costa Rican plants. María has been growing tilo for more than 10 years from which she and her family have benefited greatly. She says that she has worked very hard and put a lot of effort into the project so that it would be successful. María says that the market demand for this product is very high and because of this she wants to increase the amount of tilo that she plants and also maintain the quality. For this reason she is requesting a loan of ¢500,000 (five hundred thousand colones - Costa Rican currency) to help with the soil preparation, to buy seeds, fertilizer and other necessary raw materials that are needed to guaranteed optimum conditions for planting the tilo. She also hopes to buy wood, plastic, nails, mesh etc. as all of these materials are needed to expand the dryer. She is a member of Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Abanico, one of the partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member she received a micro loan that helped her to become an small business woman and provide a better quality of life for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and other raw materials to increase her production of tilo

loans.name: Bokk Jom/ndoffene1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité « BOKK JOM » est créé depuis 3 ans, il a 6 cycles d’existence. Il fait parti d’un des sous groupes qui composent le Banc Villageois de NDOFEENE1. Il est composé de 14 femmes toutes issues du même village et se sont organisées par affinité. Elles sont d’âges différents, entre 30 et 60 ans et sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 03 enfants. Leur activité principale est l’embouche bovine et/ou ovine, cette activité est très favorable dans la zone du fait de l’existence de beaucoup de marchés hebdomadaires. Ses marchés hebdomadaires drainent beaucoup de monde, ce qui contribue à l’accroissement de l’économie dans cette localité. Et comme activité secondaire elle font du petit commerce de céréales locales.

Madame Cécile Khémesse NGOME, en médaillon en bas et à l’extrême droite  de la photo, est âgée de 47ans, elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants et tutrice de 03 autres qui lui sont confiés par des parents. Comme ses autres camarades de groupe, elle fait de l’embouche bovine et ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis plus d’une dizaine d’années. L’objet de son crédit est de renforcer son activité et son objectif est de participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, par exemple en payant la scolarité de ses enfants et en leur assurant une bonne couverture sanitaire.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "BOKK JOM" was created three years ago, having spanned six (loan) cycles.  It is part of one of the sub-groups that make up the Banc Villageois of NDOFEENE1.  The group is composed of fourteen women, all from the same village, who are organized by affinity.  They are of different ages, ranging from 30 to 60, and are all married mothers having at least three children each.  As their main work, the group members fatten cattle and/or sheep.  This is a very favorable business, where many weekly markets exist.  These weekly markets attract a lot of people.  It helps the economy of this town to grow.  As a secondary business, the group members do a little commerce in local grains. Ms. Cécile Khémesse NGOME, whose portrait appears at the bottom and to the far right in the photo, is 47 years old and the married mother of seven children.  And she is the guardian of three others entrusted to her by relatives.  Like her friends in the group, Cécile fattens cattle and sheep.  She has been operating this business for over ten years.  The goal of her loan is to bolster her business with the aim of helping to improve her family's living conditions by, for example, paying the schooling costs for her children and ensuring good health care for them.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and further developing their revenue-generating businesses

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia tiene 60 años, vive en su casa propia con su hijo. Desde su niñez ha aprendido el valor del trabajo en las tareas agrícolas, por lo que se dedica a cultivar maíz y cuidarlas de insectos y plagas. Es así que cada día desde el alba empieza su jornada en el campo, además posee animal vacuno, siendo ésta vendidas los fines de semana, asimismo vende parte de los productos que cosecha. Es así que las ganancias que obtiene le ayudan a cubrir los gastos domésticos que tiene. Se siente muy contenta por la labor que  realiza y por ello desea incrementar la cantidad que tiene actualmente. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo que se le considera una persona responsable con sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará sacos de abono y un toro para aumentar la cantidad de animales que posee.
texts.en:
Lidia is 60 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter. Since childhood she has learned the value of agricultural work, and so she now grows corn and protects it from insects and disease. She begins each day in the field with her livestock, and sells part of her harvest each weekend. The income from these sales help her pay her household costs. She is very happy with her work, and would like to increase her business. This is her 2nd loan with MFP, and she considers herself to be responsible with money. With the loan Lidia requests, she will buy compost and a ball to increase her livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase compost and a bull

loans.name: Sope Serigne Fallou/ndoffene Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité « SOPE ERIGNE FALLOU » du Banc Villageois deNDOFFENE1 est composé de 11 femmes toutes issues du même village. Elles ont créé leur groupe de solidarité par liens de parenté et d’affinité depuis la mise en place de leur Banc Villageois en 2007. Dans le groupe on trouve des femmes d’âges différents (entre 35 et 50 ans), elles sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 3 enfants. Elles ont comme activités principale l’embouche bovine et/ou ovine. Et comme activité secondaire elle font du petit commerce de céréales locales. La proximité des marchés hebdomadaire leur facilite l’écoulement de leurs produits. 

La responsable du groupe de solidarité Madame NAR N. debout à droit de la photo en grand boubou  jaune avec de fleurettes, est âgée de 58 ans ; elle est mariée et mère de 7 enfants en charge. Elle fait de l’embouche ovine et vend du mil et de l’huile d’arachide qu’elle prépare de ses mains. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité afin de se procurer de plus de bénéfices qui contribueront à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, par exemple la nourriture et la santé.
texts.en:
The borrowing group "Sope Erigne Fallou" of the NDOFFENE1 Village Bank consists of 11 women, all from the same village. They created their group through links of kinship and affinity after the establishment of their Village Bank in 2007. In the group are women of different ages (between 35 and 50). They are all married and mothers of at least 3 children. Their main activities are beef fattening and/or sheep fattening. As a secondary activity they have small local grain businesses. The proximity of the weekly markets facilitates the sales of their products. The head of the group is Mrs. Nar N., standing in the right of the photo in the full yellow robe with flowers. She is 58; married and a mother of 7 children. She fattens sheep and sells millet and groundnut oil that she prepares by hand. Her new loan will allow her to strengthen her business in order to obtain more earnings which will contribute to the improvement of her family's living conditions, such as food and health.

Translated from French by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop and promote their businesses

loans.name: Guillermo Javier

texts.es:
Guillermo es un padre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, una zona de bastante crecimiento económico que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de un año a la crianza  y venta de animales menores, especialmente cuyes y patos, el cría sus animales en su propio domicilio y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona para comprarlos y revenderlos en la ciudad de Chiclayo y en el mismo distrito de Cayaltí.

Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia, adicionalmente trabaja como peón agrícola en una empresa agroindustrial de la región. Su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para brindarles a sus hijas una buena educación.

Es siguiendo esta meta que ha decidido ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta comprando más animales para anpliar su negocio y alimento balanceado para lograr que se desarrollen de buena manera, de modo que pueda percibir mayores ingresos con los cuales sacar adelante a sus hijas. Por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Guillermo es un padre bastante responsable y entregado a su familia. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le tienen mucha estima y le consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 33-year-old father who lives with his wife and two children in the agricultural district of Cayalti, a well-developed area located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For over a year he has raised and sold small animals, especially guinea pigs and ducks. He raises the animals in his own home and when they have reached a good level of development he offers them to the dealers who are always visiting the area to buy and re-sell the animals in Chiclayo and in the same district of Cayalti. This business greatly helps his family, and he also works as an agricultural worker for a local agroindustrial company. His greatest desire is to keep working to offer his daughters a good education. Following this goal, he has decided to expand his business through buying more animals to expand his business, and balanced food so that they will develop well. This way he will make a better income to get his daughters ahead. With this motivation he has requested his first loan with Edpyme Alternativa: 1000 soles. Guillermo is a very responsible father, dedicated to his family. In the area where he lives his neighbours and acquaintances hold him in high esteem and consider him to be a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Small animals, and balanced food

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de  44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa que es propia.Desde hace  20 años, cría ganado vacuno, que atiende en su establo, diariamente ve su progreso, alimenta a sus animales con comida balanceada, también les da alfalfa, ya que depende mucho de su alimentación diaria, pues comercializa la leche de las vacas. Además paralelamente se dedica a la agricultura, siembra papa, maíz, alverja, entre otros productos naturales. Por los años de intenso trabajo se ha dado cuenta que su economía se mantiene estable, aun en los momentos difíciles, razón por la cual esta planeando para el  futuro adquirir mas cantidad de  animales y algunas extensiones de terreno que necesita sembrar.Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que será muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas, además  agradece  a todas las  personas que hicieron posible el  préstamo, porque le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Yolanda tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de una vaca joven y algunos sacos de abono para la próxima temporada de siembra.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 44, lives with her husband and 2 children in their own home. For 20 years, she has raised cattle which she attends in their stable. Every day she sees their progress, feeds them balanced food, and gives them alfalfa since they depend greatly on her daily feeding. She sells the cows' milk. She also farms: she plants potatoes, corn, peas and other natural products. Through the years of hard work she has seen that her economic situation has remained stable, despite difficult moments. So she is planning in the future to acquire more animals and land to plant. This is her second loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her repayments. She also thanks all of the people who are making this loan possible, because it will be very useful in the progress of her business. Yolanda plans to invest the requested loan in the purchase of a young cow and some bags of fertilizer for the next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase a young cow and fertilizer

loans.name: Blanca Andrea

texts.es:
Blanca es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el caserío Filoque, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, el distrito con la extensión geográfica mas grande de la región, se caracteriza por tener a la mayor parte de su población agrupada en caseríos pequeños que distan mucho uno del otro, sus principales actividades son la agricultura y el comercio. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace dos años a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda. Este negocio le provee de ingresos con los que ayuda a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares y también es de mucha ayuda para sus vecinos, ya que la zona en donde vive se encuentra alejada del pueblo y ellos no cuentan con acceso rápido a productos de uso diario.

Blanca desea incrementar sus ventas comprando mas productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes y así obtener mayores ingresos, por este motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de mas mercaderia para lograr su objetivo.

Blanca es una mujer alegre y optimista, en la zona donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos la estiman mucho y la consideran una persona de confianza.
texts.en:
Blanca is a 44-year-old mother who lives with her husband and children in the hamlet of Filoque, a rural area of the Olmos district, the largest district of the region. it is known for having the majority of its population grouped in small hamlets with much distance between them. The main activities of the area are agriculture and business. It belongs to the Lambayeque province and is located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo. For two years she has sold basic needs products and groceries in a store in her home. This business provides her earnings with which she helps her husband with household costs. Her business is also a great help for her neighbours, since the area where they live is far from the village and they do not have fast access to daily use items. Blanca wants to increase her sales through buying more products to offer her customers and thus to obtain better earnings. Thus, she has requested her first loan of 2000 soles with Edpyme Alternativa. She plans to invest in the purchase of more merchandise to meet her goal. Blanca is a happy and optimistic woman. In her neighbourhood her neighbours and acquaintances hold her in high esteem and consider her to be a trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Basic needs items and groceries

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es: Luis Manuel tiene una pulpería hace más de 3 años. Pues sus inicios se dan cuando termina de graduarse de secundaria y no tiene trabajo por lo que decide comenzar una nueva fuente de ingresos con el poco capital de trabajo que posee, además tiene una familia a la cual debe proporcionarle alimento diario, anteriormente el ofrecía jabón, detergentes, golosinas y refrescos naturales con este crédito quiere mejorar  su negocio él se encuentra muy emocionado con esta oportunidad que le está brindando con los financiamientos. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como golosinas, jugos, detergentes, pan y galletas.
texts.en:
Luis Manuel has had a small grocery store for more than 3 years. Its founding came about when he had just graduated from high school and didn't have a job. He decided to find a new way of earning money using the little capital he had, so he could feed his family. He already offers soap, detergents, candy and natural beverages and hopes to improve his business with this loan. He is very excited at the opportunity that he is getting with this loan. The loan is to buy inventory like candy, juice, detergents, bread and cookies.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Ileana Mercedes

texts.es: Ileana Mercedes tiene 38 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre le ha gustado ser una persona independiente disfruta también tiene que mantener a sus 3 hijos que todavía están a su cargo, por lo que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, no es la primera experiencia que tiene con los financiamientos pero se encuentra muy contenta de administrar bien su negocio. El financiamiento es para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite y cosméticos. Sueña con volver su pulpería en una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Ileana Mercedes is 38 years old and has been operating a general store for more than two years. She has always wanted to be an independent person and also enjoys supporting her three children who are still under her care. Ileana is always looking for ways to improve her income.

This is not her first experience working with loans and she is very happy that they have helped her manage her business well. This loan will be used to buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, and cosmetics. She dreams of converting her store into a distribution center.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Jupilier

texts.en:
Jupilier C., age 25, is from the village of Poblacion Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He is 25 years old. Jupilier is married, and he and his wife have a baby. To make a living, Jupilier owns and operates a business providing motor transport services. Jupilier has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Jupilier joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Jupilier has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,0000 PHP from GDMPC. Jupilier is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. 

This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jupilier from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma P., age 53, is from the village of Matugas, Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Norma and her husbnad have seven adult-aged children. To make a living, Norma raises cows for sale. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Norma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used additional capital for her business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Norma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use additional capital for her livestock business

loans.name: Renante

texts.en:
Renante H., age 32, is from the village of Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He and his wife have a school-aged child. To make a living, Renante provides motorcycle transport services to local community members. Renante has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Renante joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. He hoped to help improve his living situation and increase his ability to engage in business activities. Renante is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Renante from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide transportation service

loans.name: Fernalin

texts.en:
Fernalin M., age 35, is from the village of Corrales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She and her husband have a school-aged child. To make a living, Fernalin provides motorcycle services to local community members. Fernalin has been engaged in her business for over  a year and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Fernalin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Fernalin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Fernalin is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fernalin from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide transportation service

loans.name: Rochell Liza

texts.en:
Rochell Liza G., a 27-year-old single woman from the city of Prenza Tangub, owns and operates a specialized retail store selling a variety of products such as biscuits, noodles, sugar, salt, vinegar, cooking oil, etc. Engaged in her business for over three years, she earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rochell Liza joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to invest in expanding the business, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gloria Adela

texts.es:
La señora Gloria vive en la Sequita,  localidad de Montecristi prospero cantón manabita,  gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, Gloria se dedica a la venta informal de productos de belleza como  perfumes y otros artículos de Yanbal.

La señora Gloria está casada, lleva 5 años formando parte del banco comunal,  tiene 5 hijos, 4 mayores solo uno de ellos vive con ella, el esposo trabaja en una fábrica de pescado en la ciudad de Manta. Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de productos  Yanbal, atreves de catálogo.

  El dinero que está solicitando a la fundación podrá invertir todo en comprar los productos, a su clientes les brinda la facilidad de pagos dejándoles a créditos en dos o tres cuotas por mes, una vez que reúne la inversión sigue con mas pedidos, vende por el sector donde vive y en el puerto de Manta, con este nuevo crédito podrá invertir todo en sus productos, tiene varios pedidos por el mes del padre.

Nuestra socia esta conforme con su negocio, sueña con seguir ayudando a sus hijos, ya que sus  hijos estudian y quiere que sigan adelante, ella y su familia viven  en una casa propia que también aspira algún día poder adecuarla mejor.
texts.en:
Gloria lives in La Sequita, Montecristi, part of the prosperous Manabí canton whose residents are hard-working and proud of their roots. She sells Yanbal brand beauty products. Gloria is married and has five children, four of whom are independent adults and one who still lives with her. Her husband works for a fish processing plant in Manta. She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and she sells Yanbal catalogue products. She will use the requested funds to buy stock merchandise. She offers her customers credit charging easy payments two or three times a month. Once she earns back her investment she can proceed with more orders. She sells in her own neighborhood and in the port of Manta. She will use the entire loan amount to buy merchandise because she has several pending orders for Father’s Day. She is satisfied with her business and dreams with continuing to support her children since they are studying and she wants them to continue moving forward. She and her family live in their own home which she hopes someday to improve.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy perfume, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen P., age 32, is from the city of Sta Cruz Tangub City. She and her husband have three school-aged children. To make a living, Helen prepares and sells cooked food for her customers' daily meals. Helen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Helen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make her products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Helen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make her prepared food products for sale

loans.name: Gloria Monserrate

texts.es:
La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, es gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que  saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

Es en este bello lugar es donde conocimos a la señorita Gloria, ella vive en La Sequita con sus padres y hermanos es soltera tiene 19 años y vende productos Avon desde hace 6 meses, deja sus productos  a crédito y cobra todas las semanas, reúne el dinero para hacer los pedidos, Gloria también trabaja en una empresa privada, su papá hace trabajos de ebanistería y su mamá se dedica al hogar, en la empresa que trabaja tiene un año,  se dedica a la limpieza de pescado, el horario de trabajo en la empresa depende de cuánto trabajo haya, al negocio de Avon se dedica los sábados y domingos, tiene algunos clientes, lo que más vende son cremas y perfumes, las  ventas también dependen mucho de qué época es, o que fechas están próximas en lo que concierne a fiestas, ya que en fechas festivas se vende más el producto, porque las personas hacen muchos pedidos para obsequiar a sus familiares, como por ejemplo para el día del padre o la madre.

 Lleva tres ciclos y el crédito que está solicitando es para invertir todo en productos Avon. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y ser productiva para el país.
texts.en:
The Sequita parish is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton of Manabí. Its residents are hard-working and proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish whose residents are honest people who know how to work and are dedicated to their families. It was in this beautiful place that we met Gloria. She lives in La Sequita with her parents and siblings. She’s 19-years-old and single. For the past 6 months she has sold Avon products. She sells on credit and collects weekly payments. As payments come in she places more orders. Gloria is also employed in a private firm. Her father is a cabinet maker and her mother is a housewife. Gloria has been employed for a year cleaning fish. Her work schedule depends on how much work the firm has. She sells Avon on weekends and she has a few regular customers. What she sells most are creams and perfumes. Sales are seasonal or dependent on what feast days are approaching because during these times, like Mother’s Day and Father’s Day, sales rise because people place more orders in order to have gifts for their families. This is her 3rd loan cycle and she will use the requested funds to buy Avon products. Her dream is to continue working and be a productive member of society.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy creams, cosmetics, perfumes.

loans.name: Salceda

texts.en:
Salceda E., age 50, is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Tangub City. She is 50 years old. Salceda is widowed and has three adult-aged children. In the picture, Salceda is the one wearing a white blouse and a jacket. She is pictured with her driver. To make a living, Salceda provides motor transportation services. Salceda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Salceda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Salceda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Salceda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Salceda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better transportation service

loans.name: Maryori Del Rosio

texts.es:
La señora Maryori es socia del banco comunal la Sequita desde hace 15 ciclos le ha ido muy bien con los créditos obtenidos,  vive en la Parroquia La Sequita perteneciente al cantón Montecristi en la provincia de Manabí, ella como la mayoría de los habitantes de este bello rincón manabita es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable.

Nuestra socia esta casada desde hace 22 años,  tiene 5 hijos,  de 22, 18, 17, 16 y 12 años, junto a la familia tienen un negocio de ebanistería donde realizan trabajos  a base de madera como muebles, sillas y camas pero en lo que se especializan es en la elaboración de muebles para maquinas de coser, este negocio lo mantiene desde hace 25 años en la misma parroquia en su casa, nos comentó que es un negocio que lo heredaron del suegro, la familia de su esposo siempre habían trabajado en este tipo de negocio, ella junto sus  hijos y esposo siguieron manteniéndolo hasta los actuales momentos que es con lo cual sacan adelante a la familia.

Con este nuevo crédito la señora Maryori podrá invertir todo en materiales como madera de laurel que es con la que mas trabajan al igual que los demás materiales necesarios como clavos, pintura y herramientas, tiene bastante clientes a los cuales tiene que cumplir, desde muy temprano de lunes a sábado le dedican a  entregar a sus clientes los trabajos, tiene un vehículo  lo cual le permite al esposo de nuestra socia entregar a tiempo la obra.
texts.en:
Mayori has been a member of the La Sequita communal bank for 15 cycles and she has done well with the loans received. She lives in La Sequita parish, part of Montecristi canton, Manabí province. She, like most residents of this beautiful corner of Manabí, is a very hard-working, responsible woman. She has been married for 22 years and has 5 children who are 22, 18, 17, 16 and 12 years of age. They have a cabinet making shop next to their home where they make wood-based items like furniture, chairs and beds. Their specialty, however, is making cabinets for sewing machines. She has had this business for 25 years in her home in the same parish. She told us that the business was inherited from her in-laws. Her husband’s family had always been in this line of work. She, her husband and her children continue running it until the present time; this is how they have supported the family. Mayori will use this new loan to buy materials like laurel wood, which is the wood they use the most, as well as other supplies like nails, paint and tools. She has quite a few customers to satisfy so work starts very early from Monday through Saturday. They own a vehicle that makes it possible for her husband to deliver items on time to their customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber, nails, paint, glue and tools.

loans.name: Mercedes Marlene

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes vive en la Sequita, parroquia de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro, desde hace 19 ciclos forma parte del banco comunal la sequita.

En los actuales momentos nuestra socia se dedica al negocio familiar junto al esposo, el negocio consiste en la venta de legumbres en el canton Montecristi, mientras la señora Mercedes se dedica a su hogar y a sus hijos, el esposo sale los días jueves, viernes, sábado y domingo a las ventas con dos de sus hijos hasta el medio día porque ellos estudian, las compras de las legumbres la realiza en la ciudad de Portoviejo donde  están los grandes mayoristas.

La señora Mercedes tiene de casada 19 años y  4 hijos, con este nuevo crédito nuestra socia podrá invertir  en el negocio de las legumbres, tiene sus clientes fijos sale desde la madruga y regresa a casa en las tardes.
texts.en:
Mercedes lives in La Sequita, a parish in Montecristi, a canton known for being the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro [José Eloy Alfaro (1842-1912) was an Ecuadorian revolutionary leader and president. He is the great hero of Ecuadorian radicals]. She has been a member of the La Sequita communal bank for 19 cycles. She is currently involved with the family business with her husband; it consists in vegetable sales in Montecristi. While Mercedes takes care of the children and the home, her husband goes out on Thursdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays to sell until noon because two of their children, who still have to go to school, help him. The vegetables are purchased in the city of Portoviejo which is where the large wholesalers are. Mercedes has been married for 19 years and has 4 children. She will use this new loan to buy vegetables for her business. She has regular customers and she goes out at dawn and returns home in the afternoon.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potatoes, carrots, corn, broad beans, fruit, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma B. is from the village of Liloan Bonifacio. She is 60 years old. Norma is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Norma owns & operates a business selling daily use products and fruits in the local community. Norma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Norma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Norma is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Norma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Umutkan's Group

texts.en:
Umutkan D. is the leader of the group. She is 37 and married. Her husband works as a constructor and earns 10,000 soms per month. They have three sons. One son studies at school. The other sons do not go to school yet. Five years ago, with an initial investment of 5,000 soms, Umutkan began to take orders, sew and sell national cloth and dressmaking supplies. In this way, she makes 15,000 soms per month. The success of the past five years made it possible for her to purchase three sewing machines, hire workers and rent an office. With money received from the loan, Umutkan wants to purchase fabric and materials. In the future, she plans to expand her business and buy a vehicle.

Eliza K. is the treasurer of the group. She is 32. In order to earn some money, her husband works at two jobs as a constructor and as a taxi driver.  They have two daughters and a son; all of them study at school. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 20,000 soms, Eliza bought six farm animals and resold them after fattening. She made good money and since that moment, Eliza has been breeding livestock. Now she makes 5,000 soms per month and with the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase more livestock for breeding.

Eliza A. is 22 and divorced. She works as a waitress. Two years ago, with an initial investment of 15,000 soms, Eliza bought five farm animals and started to breed them. In two years, she increased the number of livestock to 12. Eliza applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase some calves for breeding. In autumn, when the price will be higher, she plans to resell them and make some money.

Narynbek T. is 25 and married. He works at the police department and a year ago, with an initial investment of 8,000 soms, he bought two farm animals and started to breed them. He applied for the loan because needs money to purchase more farm animals to increase the number of livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young, ambitious and socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). Mol Bulak is the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the Mol Bulak Finance staff.

loans.use: To purchase fabric and materials

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 42 years old. He is a married father of three children between the ages of 6 and 15 years old. All the children are currently attending school.

He is a dedicated farmer from Nyamira town in Western Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for 25 years and has employed two people on a temporary basis. His products are sorghum, beans, maize and milk, which he sells to the local market. He also earns income from the sale of tea.

His biggest challenge in farming is the high cost of animal feed due to limited land to plant the animal feed.

He recently completed his previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 45,000 and is requesting this loan for Kes. 60,000 to purchase a dairy cow. The proceeds from this loan will be used to pay school fees and improve the living standards of the family.

In the future, he would like to buy more cows and land to expand his farming activities in order to increase his income.

He is grateful to Juhudi because it has improved his living standards.  He says that the interest rate is affordable and promises to continue being a member.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Najma Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Najma bibi lives in Multan, a city of shrines and sweetmeat in Pakistan, with her husband and seven children. Her husband has a scrap business and sells ice cream in the evening. Najma bibi helps her husband by selling clothes through her boutique. She also stitches the clothes. Two of her sons couldn’t complete their education; they started working after completing middle school to support the family.  

Najma bibi has applied for a loan for her husband who wants a new ice cream machine for his ice cream selling business. With a new ice cream machine, her husband will be able to make ice cream of better quality that will help in growing his income.

Note: "Najma bibi is making bread in this picture".

loans.use: To purchase a new ice-cream making machine

loans.name: Norulah Khayat Group

texts.en: Norulah is the group leader of Norulah Khayat group. He lives in District 8 in Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his father and mother, so they live in a small family.
