With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Liberty has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000 - uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000, which she intends to use to pay for the franchise of a vehicle that will be used for business so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. 

Liberty D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Zam

texts.en:
Zam is married with five children, all of whom are in school. She takes care of additional family members (her old parents). Zam owns a charcoal store in the Kalerwe market and sells to all categories of people.  

She plans to use this loan to buy more bags of charcoal to increase her stock. She has been selling charcoal for the last 10 years. Zam buys bags of charcoal from the villages of Luwero and sells both on a retail and wholesale basis. Besides this charcoal business, she also gets additional income from a motorcycle. 

Her customers are the local people around the area. She works seven days a week. She depends on this job for a living. Her business challenges are thieves and transportation. Formerly, Zam was aspiring of going directly to villages for charcoal and now she is aspiring to educate her children up to university. 

Zam resides in and owns a four-roomed house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Zelah Group

texts.en:
Varbah H., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Zelah'. She is 39 years old, single and has 3 children who range from 12 to 23 years old. She was only able to attend school through 6th grade due to financial constraints. All of her children are attending school and she also cares for one sibling.

For more than 3 years, she has been selling charcoal and salt at Waterside Market, downtown Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 42,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more of bags of charcoal and salt. She describes herself as a God-fearing woman.

Her plan is to improve her business and build a shop.

loans.use: To buy more of bags of charcoal and salt

loans.name: Everything Has Time Group

texts.en:
Edwin W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Everything Has Time'. He is 46 years old, married, and has eight children who range from 6 months to 17 years old. He was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to poverty. For 7 years, he has been selling blocks and charcoal at Thinkers Village Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of cement for block-making and more charcoal. He describes himself as a hard-working man with good behavior.

His dream is to expand his business and become an employer.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement for blocks and charcoal

loans.name: Basilisa

texts.en:
Basilisa E. is a 63 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store business and rice retailer business. She lives in Barangay Jantianon, Amlan Negros Oriental with her husband, Cruc, who is 67 years old. Their 10 children, who are between 28-45 years old, also live with them. Nine of the children already have their own families and 1 is working.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and rice retail business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP15,000.

Basilisa is now borrowing PHP17,000 to use as additional working capital for her general store. This will be her 15th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP24,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Basilisa aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is married with six children and all of them are at school.  Edith also takes care of additional family members. She owns a retail shop in Kawempe selling all types of merchandise. Edith buys this merchandise from Kikuubo, one of the busiest places in Kampala city.  She has been in this business for eighteen years. She wants to use this the loan to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt and boxes of soap.  

Edith pays monthly rent of 50,000 for her retail shop and residence. She sells to all categories of people and works seven days a week.   Edith joined MCDT to get additional capital for her retail shop. She resides in and rents a two-roomed house. The family has access to electricity and piped water.  Edith's monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, and boxes of soap

loans.name: Dennis Arnaldo

texts.es:
Denniss de 21 años vive en una zona periurbana de Guayaquil, el tiene un puesto de comida y bebidas en su casa, gracias a sus padres que le heredaron el negocio. 

Cuando el era pequeña sus padres tuvieron un negocio de comidas y el siempre observaba como trabajaban y cocinaban, cuando creció sus padres decidieron darle el negocio de venta de comidas y bebidas. Ahora vende almuerzos y meriendas con jugos todos los días, se levanta muy de mañana para hacer la comida,  pero para tener mas ingresos el quiere readecuar el local comprando con el préstamo una cocineta, cilindro de gas, mesas y sillas para mejorar el negocio. 

En el futuro quiere tener su propio restaurante y tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Dennis is 21 years old and lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. He runs a stand selling food and drinks out of his home, thanks to his parents who passed the business down to him. When Dennis was young, his parents had a business selling food and he always observed how they worked and cooked. When he grew up, his parents decided to give him their business. Now he sells lunches, snacks, and drinks every day. He gets up early in the morning to prepare the food, but to increase his income, he would like to refurbish his workspace. He would use this loan to improve his business by buying a kitchenette, a gas cylinder, tables, and chairs. In the future, Dennis hopes to have his own restaurant and his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a kitchenette, tables, and chairs

loans.name: C4557 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 28 years old, married with two children.  Jacqueline is the president of a group called 'Tuzamurane' and this group owns a restaurant where they sell foods in order to earn their daily living.  This group has been in this business for about 5 years and the hours of the business are from early in the morning until late in the evening hours.

This group is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, this group will purchase equipment and increase the quantity of food which in turn will increase profits.  With these profits, the members of this group will pay school fees for their children and continue taking care of their families.  In addition, they will keep reinvesting in their business for better financial stability.

loans.use: Additional equipment and food for the restaurant

loans.name: Yairo Francisco

texts.es: Yairo tiene 27 años el se dedica a la venta de ornados y repostería. Hace as de 5 años que tiene este negocio, el vive con su familia en una comarca de achuapa a pesar de que no tienen todas las comodidades el cada día se supera para proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario. Además que sale todos los días a ofrecer los productos que el mismo elabora el es joven muy ejemplar pues además es un buen hijo y padre al mismo tiempo a pesar de que recorre muchos lugares siempre está contento de ofrecer a sus clientes lo mejor en calidad. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima como mantequilla, queso, harina entre otras cosas. Sueña con proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda y obtener otro medio de ingreso.
texts.en:
Yairo is 27 years old and sells baked goods and desserts. He has had this business for five years and lives with his family an area of Achuapa. Even though they do not have all of the comforts, he works hard each day in order to provide his family with their daily needs. He sells the products that he makes daily and is a very exemplary young man, a good son, and a good father. He is always happy to offer his best quality products to his customers. He will use the money from this loan to buy ingredients, including butter, cheese, and flour, among other things. He hopes to someday offer his family a better home and obtain an additional source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Ingredients

loans.name: Primavera Group

texts.es:
El comité  Primavera  se encuentra en su décimo tercer ciclo, cada una se encuentra trabajando en sus actividades dependiendo de las facilidades con que cuentan.
Ademas realizan trabajos en conjunto para recaudar fondos, todas son muy responsables y activas, una de ellas es la señora Maria quien se dedica a la cofección de ropas para damas. 
Ella trabaja en su salon de acuerdo a los pedidos que recibe, asi ella puede ayudar a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
Su objetivo es la de trabajar mucho para terminar su vivienda.
Ella solicita el prestamo para la compra de pinturas para el salón y pago de mano de obra ya que quiere hacer algunas mejoras en su taller de costura.
texts.en:
The Primavera Group is in its thirteenth cycle, each one of its members working on her activities depending on the means available. In addition to working as a whole to raise funds, all of the members are very responsible and active. One of the them is Maria, who works making women’s clothing. She works in her living room, fulfilling the requests that she receives so she can her help her family with household expenses. Her goal is to work hard in order to finish her home. Maria is requesting a loan to buy paint for the living room and to pay for the labor since she wants to make some improvements in her sewing workspace.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of paint and payment for labor

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia L. is a 39-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy. Novallas, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating a general store and electronic reloading business. Her husband, Cipriano, is a 46-year-old farmer and they have no children.

Delia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,000 PHP from her business activities.

Delia is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP was used to fund the operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact in both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 15th loan cycle, the amount of 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use on her general store and electronic reloading business. Delia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Saidati

texts.en:
Saidati is 56 years old, married, with 5 children who are between 11 and 25 years old.  Saidati is commonly known in the business of selling women's clothes and the hours of her business are from 7 am to 6 pm every day.

Although Saidati has spent a long time in this business, her capital is still too low to allow her to expand meaningfully.  To put an end to this situation, Saidati needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  This loan will hopefully allow her to increase her sales as well as profits.  With these profits, Saidati will continue paying the school fees of her children and providing enough food for them.  In addition, she will start saving for better financial stability.

loans.use: buying additional women's clothing for sale

loans.name: Sope Serigne Mbacke Sokhna Lô Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité « SOPE SERIGNE MBACKE SOKHNA LÔ » est crée en 2007 au jour de l’inauguration du Banc Villageois qui abrite ledit Banc Villageois. Il est composé de 10 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village et sont organisées par affinité. Elles sont pratiquement de la même génération, elles un ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et sont toutes mariées et mères d’au moins de 03 enfants. Elles font en général de l’embouche bovine, mais certaines associent à cette activité le petit commerce de céréales locales, de poissons frais et de légumes. 

La présidente du groupe de solidarité, Fatou N. en second rang, debout et à droite sur la photo, est âgée de 50 ans elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants en charges. Elle fait essentiellement de l’embouche ovine, elle en a une bonne expérience car avant même qu’elle ne soit bénéficiaire des prêts de l’institution CAURIE-MF elle pratiquait cette activité. Avec son nouveau crédit elle pourra acheter plus de moutons pour faire l’accroissement de son activité afin de se procurer plus de bénéfices pour pouvoir faire face aux besoins familiaux, par exemple assurer le payement de la scolarité de ses enfants et leur couverture sanitaire.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "SOPE SERIGNE MBACKE SOKHNA LÔ" has been created in 2007, the day of the inaugraton of the local Banc Villageois. It is composed of ten women, all of whom reside in the same village and know each other as friends. They are all more or less of the same generation and are on the average 40 years old; all are married and are the mothers of at least three children. Their main line of business is raising cattle, and some of them also sell local cereals, fresh fish and vegetables on the side. The leader of the solidarity group, Fatou N. pictured on the photo standing in the second row on the right, is 50 years old and the mother of eight dependent children. She mainly raises sheep, and has had plenty of experience with it even before taking out any loans from CAURIE-MF microfinance institutions. With this new credit she will be able to buy more sheep in order to expand her activity and increase her earnings, with the goal of better meeting her family’s needs, such as for example the school fees and healthcare costs of her children.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering the investment capital of the solidarity group

loans.name: Fedila

texts.en:
Fedila Y. is a 50 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a vegetable business. She lives in Barangay Jantianon, Amlan, Negros Oriental with her 47 year old husband, Florencio, who works as a driver, and with their 2 children who are between 18-21 years old and are currently studying.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her vegetable vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 15,000.

Fedila is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she could continue her vegetable vending business. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Fedela aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  


 About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: For Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El Sr Ángel V. O. se encuentra casado, tiene 5 hijos, viven en la comunidad de Chullpani Grande sobre la carretera Cbba - Santa Cruz zona rural dentro del municipio de Colomi.

Ángel y su esposa Bertha se dedican a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, papa liza, para vender en  la feria semanal de Colomi según nos cuentan todo lo que llegan a cosechar no solo les sirve como ingreso si no también es su mayor fuente de alimento, Solicitan el crédito a la institución para compra de semilla de haba pues es el mayor producto que se siembra en la zona donde viven.  
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              El señor Ángel nos comenta que como actividad secundaria se dedica a la construcción de viviendas como albañil, de esta manera poder incrementar sus ingresos y poder darles una mejor vida a sus hijos. Su mayor sueño es poder en un futuro comprar mas terreno para ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ángel V. O. is married and has 5 children. They live in the Chullpani Grande Community on the Cbba-Santa Cruz Highway in a rural region within the municipality of Colomi. Ángel and his wife Bertha grow potatoes, beans, oca (an edible root) and papa liza (a tuber grown in the Andean region) to sell at the weekly market in Colomi. They tell us that what they harvest not only serves as income, but also their main source of food. They are requesting a loan to buy bean seeds as beans are the main crop planted in the region where they live. Ángel tells us that he also works in housing construction as a mason in order to augment his income and to be able to give his children a better life. His dream is to be able to buy more land so that he can grow more crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bean seeds

loans.name: Ceila

texts.es:
Ceila vive en la zona Ballivián  de la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, en la casa de sus padres donde tienen un pequeño taller de costura y donde confeccionan buzos deportivos, chamarras  y otros, según los pedidos que les realicen.

Como segunda actividad  se desempeña como enfermera auxiliar particular día por medio, con lo cual colabora a sus ingresos familiares.


El crédito lo destinará en la compra de tela y otras materias primas para su producción de buzos deportivos, chamarras y otros.
 
Es el tercer crédito con Impro y segundo vía Kiva  y la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgar el crédito.
texts.en:
Ceila lives in the Ballivián area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and their school age children. They live in her parents’ house, where they have a small sewing shop. They make sportswear, jackets, and other items according to the orders they are filling. As a second activity she works as a private nurse’s assistant, and this is a way for her to contribute to the family income. The loan is to buy fabric and other raw materials for her production of sportswear, jackets, and other items. This is her third loan with Impro and her second with Kiva. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric and thread, etc. for her business of making sportswear and jackets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy ingredients to make more "roscas" (rolls in the shape of a circle)

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita Q. is a 46 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a pig fattening business. She lives in Barangay Jantianon, Amlan, Negros Oriental with her 52 year old husband Rico and their 6 children who are between 9 and 23 years old and are all currently going to school. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her pig fattening business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000. Teresita is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she could continue her pig fattening business. This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Teresita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.es:
EL señor Gerónimo P. Castellón tiene 43 años, está casado con la señora Nemesia Mérida de P. por más de 23 años tiene 6 hijos. Viven en Segunda Candelaria comunidad Chaupy Suyo zona rural hacia el norte de Colomi

El señor Gerónimo trabaja como agricultor y su esposa le ayuda con la venta de los productos que cosecha en los días de feria en Colomi. La señora Nemesia se levanta temprano para mandar a la escuela sus hijos, y posterior mente se dedica al cuidado de sus animales.
                                                                                                                                                                                    El señor Gerónimo P. se apersono a nuestras oficinas a solicitar un préstamo para comprar Abono Orgánico (gallinaza). Nos cuenta que hizo construir una vivienda invirtiendo sus recursos en eso, de tal modo le falto recurso para compa el abono para su actividad agrícola. Su meta principal es poder en un futuro solicitar un segundo crédito con el cual poder terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gerónimo P. Castellón is 43 years old and has been married to Nemesia Mérida de P. for more than 23 years. They have six children and live in the Segunda Candelaria community in the rural area of Chaupy Suyo, to the north of Colomi. Gerónimo works as a farmer and his wife helps him sell the products that he harvests at the Colomi market. Nemesia gets up early to send her children to school and afterwards she takes care of the animals. Geronimo came to our office in person to request a loan to purchase organic fertiliser (chicken manure). He told us that he has invested his savings in building his house, which means he doesn’t have the money to purchase fertiliser for his farm. His main goal is to request a second loan so he can finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase organic fertiliser

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia P. A. tiene 25 años es madre soltera de dos hijos, ella vive con sus padres en la comunidad de Tumuyo zona rural hacia el norte de Colomi, ella se dedica a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca,papa liza.

Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa holandesa para poder aumentar aún más su producción agrícola ahora con este crédito quiere sembrar más terreno y poder así incrementa sus ingresos considerablemente. Salir adelante es su mayor prioridad porque necesita trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella quiere que sus hijos puedan terminar el colegio y poder hacer una carrera profesional ya que ella no pudo terminar ni la escuela porque desde muy pequeña trabajaba junto a sus padres en el campo a la vez nos dice que la agricultura no solo le sirve como ingreso si no también como fuente de alimentación para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Lidia P. A. is 25 years old and a single mother to two children. She lives with her parents in the rural community of Tumuyo, to the north of Colomi. She works on a farm growing potatoes, beans, “oca” (an edible root) and “papa liza” (a tuber grown in the Andean region). She is asking for a loan to purchase organic fertiliser (chicken manure) and Dutch potato seeds to further increase her agricultural production. With this loan she would like to sow more land, which will considerably increase her income. Her main priority is making ends meet because she needs to work to bring up her children. She wants her children to finish high school to have the opportunity of going onto a professional career, as she wasn’t able to finish school because she has worked with her parents on the farm since she was very little. She says that agriculture is not only useful as a source of income but also as a source of food for all the family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase organic fertiliser

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene S. is a 43 year old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: general store, Buy & Sell and piggery businesses. She lives in Purok 5, Barangay Aguisan, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, Buy & Sell and Piggery businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of PHP 15,000. Arlene is now borrowing PHP 28,000 so that she could buy stock for the general store. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 22,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Arlene aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila sells women’s clothing at the central market in Nova Kahovka town. Ludmila has been in this business for four years. She enjoys her business very much and would like to develop it further. 

Ludmila is requesting a loan of 12,500 Ukrainian Hryvnia to purchase seasonal inventory. She hopes to make additional income and invest most of it back into the business. Ludmila is married with two grown-up sons.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase a computer to design items of clothing

loans.name: Marlon Enrique

texts.es: Marlon Enrique tiene 32 años, el se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este negocio, pues siempre busca la manera de mejorar su actividad. El inicio por medio de un financiamiento que obtuvo por un hermano, pero no fue suficiente para comprar todos los productos que sus clientes le solicitaban, pues poco a poco fue que invirtió en su actividad. Actualmente el solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Sueña con mejorar la estabilidad económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Marlon Enrique is 32 years old and sells general merchandise. He has had this business for over three years and is always looking for ways to improve it. He began the business with a loan from his brother, but it wasn’t enough to purchase all the products that his customers requested, so he was only able to develop his business bit by bit. He is currently requesting a loan to purchase raw materials. He dreams of being able to improve the economic stability of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Emma Leticia

texts.es:
Emma de 39 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad habían muchas flores orquídeas)  de Guayaquil,  esta separada de su esposo con el tiene dos hijos, ella tiene una tienda desde hace seis años atrás. 

Ha trabajado por 6 años desde que se separo de su esposo para mantener a sus hijos y dales una buena educación, invirtió sus ahorros comprando víveres y readecuo su sala para hacer un local. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora trabaja desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm todos los días. Para tener mas ingresos quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, aceites y bebidas. 

Pero en el futuro quiere surtir mas su tienda y así darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Emma is 39 years old and lives in an urban area of Guayaquil called “las Orquídeas” (the Orchids), which takes its name from the era of its first beginnings when there were many orchid flowers in the area. She is separated from her husband with whom she had two children. Emma has a shop which she has run for six years. In the six years that she has been separated she has worked to bring up her children and give them a good education. She invested her savings in the purchase of supplies and renovated a room in her house to create a shop. Since then she has been working from 6am to 9pm every day. Emma wants to use this loan to buy rice, oil and beverages to increase her income. However, in the future she wants to buy even more supplies for her shop to give her children a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oil, beverages

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan is married with 3 children. He owns a retail business selling toilet paper, napkins, matches, etc. Ruslan started this business 10 years ago. During this time he was able to develop it well. Ruslan offers good quality products for reasonable prices. Many customers come back. This business is the only source of income for his big family.

Ruslan is requesting a loan of 12,000 UAH to purchase inventory. Buying items in bulk, he is able to make more profit and spend it on his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa  tiene  60 años y esta casada con el  Sr. Pablino Alonso con quien tienen   tres hijos todos mayores D. edad con sus respectivas familias una D. sus hijas esta trabajando en España y le ayuda enviando Giros mensualmente para colaborar  con los gastos D. la casa.                                                                                                            La Sra. Elena hace diez años que tiene un negocio D. tiendas generales y realiza la venta D. sus mercaderias recorrrinedo las compañía y los barrios D. su Ciudad  D. Itagua que queda a 20 km D. San Lorenzo.
 Tambien en su casa tiene una despensa  para consumo D. comestibles y también mercerías  y es  donD. se queda su esposo Sr. Paublino para la atención D. los cliente D. la zona.
El crédito invertirá en la compra D. Mercería D. la Temporada D. Otoño Invierno.
Mas adelante desea ampliar su negocio hasta  que llegue a un Autoservice.
texts.en:
Tomasa, age 60, is married to Paublino Alonso. They have three grown children who have their own families. One of their daughters is working in Spain, and she helps by sending monthly money orders to contribute to the household expenses. For ten years Elena has had a business, which is a general store. She sells her merchandise by going to the companies and the neighborhoods in her city, Itagua. This city is 20 kilometers from San Lorenzo. She also has a grocery store in her house. The store also carries sewing supplies. Her husband, Paublino, stays at home and waits on the customer’s from the area. She will use the loan to buy notions for the fall and winter seasons. Later, she wants to expand her business until it becomes a supermarket.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and footwear for women, men, and children for the winter season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wood and glass to make more paintings.

loans.name: Women Of Glory Group

texts.en:
Oriena R., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Women Of Glory'. She is 34 years old, single, and has 5 children who range from 5 to 17 years old. She is a college student and cares for her parents. All of her children are attending school.

For 12 years, she has been selling frozen chicken, meat and pigs' feet at ELWA Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 16,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 76,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more cartons of frozen chicken, meat, and pigs' feet. She describes herself as a very friendly woman.

Her goal is to improve her business and buy a plot of land for her children.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of frozen chicken, meat, and pigs' feet

loans.name: Ticomo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ticomo lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras  y esforzadas una de ellas es la señora Gloria B. S., coordinadora del grupo, quien desde muy joven ha laborado para llevar el sustento a su casa y sacar adelante a sus tres hijos los cuales ya están casados.

 Ella hace cuatro años se dedica al comercio de ropa y cosméticos de la marca de manera ambulante. Las marcas con las cuales trabaja son  Avon y Arabella,  empresas que ofertan sus productos través de la venta directa y centros de ventas en donde los clientes pueden adquirir diversidad de productos tales como fragancias, productos de tocador, cosméticos, moda casual, lencería, joyería, productos para el hogar y vitaminas.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Antonia Doribel P., ella en el 2005 empezó a  vender ropa usada en los distintos barrios de Managua y María Concepción Chichilla quien comercializa ropa de cama de segunda y nuevas  desde hace seis años.

Ellas están muy agradecidas por las oportunidad que les brindo Adim tanto en la oferta de créditos como en el desarrollo empresarial y de autoestima por medio de los programas de  capacitación los cuales son  Desarrollo Humano con Enfoque de Género, Desarrollo Empresarial con Enfoque de Género, Intercambio Empresarial  y Articulación de Actores. Esto según expresaron les ha permitido administras de manera asertiva su negocio.
texts.en:
The Ticomo group is made up of three hard-working, enterprising and dedicated women. One of them is Gloria B. S., group coordinator, who has worked form a very young age to support her home and raise her three children who are now married. For the last four years she has been an itinerant clothing and brand name cosmetics merchant; she sells Avon and Arabella brand products. These are companies that offer their goods through direct sales and through sales centers where customers can buy a variety of products like fragrances, makeup items, cosmetics, casual fashion, lingerie, jewelry, items for the home and vitamins. Her fellow group members are Antonia Doribel P. who started selling used clothing in 2005 in several Managua neighborhoods and María Concepción C. who has sold new and used bed linens for the past 6 years. They are very grateful for the opportunities Adim has provided both in loans approved and in entrepreneurial and self-esteem training sessions, namely: Human Development, Focus on Gender, Business Interchange and Intercommunication Skills. They stated that these have helped them be more assertive administrators of their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothing and cosmetics.

loans.name: Yesu Nti Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Emelia describes herself as a hard-working woman who loves sales and serving customers. She is 54 years old and she is the leader of the “Yesu Nti” (translated as 'Christ’s sake') borrower group, made up of ten members.  Emelia trades in 'kente' cloth, the business through which she has made income to support her family for the past 20 years. Kente cloth is a famous richly woven traditional fabric of single or multiple colors, usually worn on special occasions like festivals, parties, out-door events and other social gatherings. 

Emelia is excited to be taking out this loan, which she plans to invest in the purchase of kente cloth in bulk to expand her market. Emelia also engages in cocoa farming as her second business. She hopes to mobilize more savings to rent a shop to showcase her kente cloth and improve her business.

Emelia is married to a farmer with four children from age 14-22 years. She hopes to secure university admission for her first born. The other members of the group are also traders in kente cloth, smoked fish, and cosmetics. They live in the same suburb of the community and as the leader Emelia ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase kente cloth in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Venus Group

texts.es:
El grupo Venus lo integran Cristiana Argentina  M., Ligia P. Porras, Margarita M. y María Eugenia G. quienes empiezan a trabajar con Adim. La coordinadora del grupo es M. quien desde pequeña ha trabajado en la realización de comida, ya que su madre tiene una comideria la cual ella actualmente administra.

Esta joven de 23 años tiene muchas metas y sueños en el ámbito del negocio desea invertir en otros rubros como ropa y en ámbito personal estudiar una carrera técnica como secretariado ejecutivo según comento.

Las otras integrantes de grupo tienen diversos tipos de negocio P. vende prendas de plata y laminado de la marca zafiro, M. vende productos avon marca reconocida por sus productos y G. vende comidas y productos avon.
texts.en:
The members of the Venus group are: Cristiana Argentina M., Ligia P. Porras, Margarita M. & María Eugenia G. who are starting to work with Admin. The group coordinator is M. who has worked preparing food since she was a little girl because her mother has an eatery that she now runs. This 23-year-old young woman has many goals and dreams in the business world; she wants to get into other areas like clothing sales. She told us that in the personal area she wants to study a technical career like executive secretary. The other group members have different types of businesses. P. sells silver and lamínate products of the Zafiro brand and M. sells Avon products; G. sells prepared food and Avon products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For basic grains, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su esposo William de 54 años, su hija Mireya que es casada y tiene una hija, Sarai de 8 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la producción de estructuras metálicas, es por ello que su familia trabaja con ella en un taller que en conjunto lograron instalar en el patio de su propia casa, lo cual le ha resultado un negocio rentable. Nancy es la encargada de la administración del negocio mientras que su esposo y su yerno se dedican íntegramente al trabajo de la fabricación de puertas ventanas y todo lo que tenga que ver con metal, logrando darle el mejor acabado ya que eso es lo que le gusta y llama la atención de la gente. Siendo este un negocio de familia, todos se han propuesto comprar nueva maquinaría y así mejorar su producción. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP siendo siempre muy puntual con todos los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará metal para elaborar de acuerdo a los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en:
Nancy, 49, is a hard-working woman. She lives in her own home together with her husband, William, 54, and her daughter Mireya who’s married and has an 8-year-old daughter, Sarai. Her business is making things out of metal; her family works with her in a workshop they installed in their own yard. This has turned into a profitable business. Nancy runs the administrative part while her husband and son-in-law actually make the doors, windows and anything else having to do with metal managing to give the best finishings to the items which is what people like and attracts their attention. Since this is a family business, they have proposed buying new machinery to improve production. This is their 9th loan with MFP; they have always been very punctual with repayments. This requested loan will be used to buy metal to manufacture the items they have on pending orders.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy metal.

loans.name: Humble Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is currently the group leader of 'Humble Trust' bank group made up of 10 members. Elizabeth is a lovely and hard-working woman. She is 48 years old and sells kente cloth to customers in her community. She also engages in farming to supplement her income. She has been selling kente cloth for 21 years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to invest the loan to purchase a variety of kente cloth to meet customers’ demand. 

Kente cloth is a famous richly woven traditional fabric of single or multiple colors usually worn on special occasions like festivals, parties, outdoor events, and other social gatherings. This has created a market for women like Elizabeth.

Elizabeth is married to a tailor and she is the mother of four children from age 5-15 years. She says that she dreams of being able to generate enough profit so that she will be able to support her first and second children through university and nursing training respectively.

loans.use: To purchase kente cloth in bulk

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es: Marleni, de 42 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo Rafael (55) y de  sus jóvenes hijos.Se dedica a la atención en su salón de belleza, el cual esta ubicado en su casa. En ese lugar ofrece el  servicio de corte de cabello, teñidos, ondulaciones, laceados, entre otros. Ya cuenta con una gran clientela, gracias a su buen trabajo y carisma en el trato al cliente. Además se siente contenta realizando su trabajo, es por esta razón, que tiene gran cantidad de clientes los cuales la prefieren ante la competencia. En su negocio tiene una gran vitrina donde ofrece variedad de productos de belleza, los cuales al ser tan vistosos y bien ubicados tienen bastante salida, es por eso que sus ganancias son regulares. En el futuro desea equipar  mejor su salón de belleza y contratar a una ayudante para mejorar  su trabajo.Es el primer  préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual con los pagos de sus cuotas.Marleni tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de  algunos productos para realizar mejor sus peinados, y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Marleni, 42, lives in her own house with her husband, Rafael, 55, and her young children. She runs a beauty salon in her home. She offers haircuts, hair coloring, hair waving and hair straightening among other services. She has quite a few regular customers thanks to her good customer service. She is happy doing her work and this is why she has so many customers that prefer her over the competition. She has a large display case in her salon where she offers a variety of beauty products which, thanks to being so well displayed and well situated, sell well; her profits, therefore, are regular. In the future, she would like to equip her beauty salon better and to hire an assistant to improve her work. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Marleni plans to use the requested funds to buy beauty products to improve her hair treatments and obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products to improve her business.

loans.name: Shalon Group

texts.es:
El grupo Shalon lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y esforzadas una de ellas es A. M. que ha sus 60 años ha trabajado de todo desde vender ropa, nacatamales, sopas, electrodomésticos etc. Ella invertirá el crédito  en aumentar su mercadería y sus negocios.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Kelia Patricia N.  Martínez quien vende ropa desde hace dos años y sueña con tener su propia casa e Ivania   M. T. quien desde hace dos años se dedica a vender comida.
texts.en:
The Shalon group is made up of three hard-working, dedicated people. One of them is A. M., 60, who has worked in many different jobs from selling clothing to selling nacatamales to soups to home appliances, etc. She will use the funds to increase her stock merchandise and her businesses. Her fellow group members are Kelia Patricia N. Martínez, who has sold clothing for two years and hopes to own her own house and Ivana M. T. who has sold prepared meals for the last two years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, home appliances and ingredients for soups and nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales)

loans.name: Megli Elizabeth

texts.es:
Megli Elizabeth D. Valverde es una joven sencilla, dulce y muy trabajadora de 21 años quien con la ayuda de su mamá desde hace dos años empezó a comercializar bisutería como chapas, pulsearas, pirañas, collares, prensapelos, anillos de concha, de coco, madera, de piedras etc. Estos productos los compra en el populoso Mercado Oriental, el mercado más grande de Nicaragua.
Ella con el préstamo comprara mercadería para mejorar su negocio y prosperar.
texts.en:
Megli Elizabeth D. Valverde is an unassuming, hard-working 21-year-old young woman who, with help from her mother, has sold costume jewelry like broaches, bracelets, hairpins, necklaces, hair clips, rings made of seashell, coconut, wood, stone, etc. She buys the items in the crowded Oriental market, Nicaragua’s largest. She will use the funds to buy merchandise to improve her business and prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry like: necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc.

loans.name: Awurade Ye Group

texts.en:
Adwoa A. describes herself as hard-working woman. She is 57 years old and she is the leader of the “Awurade ye” (translated as 'The Lord is good') borrower group. Adwoa is a petty trader who has been selling foodstuffs like cassava, plantains, cocoyams and bananas for the past 30 years. She also engages in farming as her second business to make extra income. 

Adwoa is excited to be taking out this loan, which she will use to purchase plantains, cassava, and cocoyams in bulk. She dreams of being able to expand her market.  She is married to a farmer and together they have four children from age 18-25 years old. Adwoa hopes to mobilize more savings to buy a piece of land to start building a house to accommodate her family.

The group is in the third cycle. The other members of Adwoa’s group are mostly farmers, and as the leader she ensures regular meeting attendance and repayment of loan installments.

loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs in bulk

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 28 años, comparte su vida en su casa propia a lado de su esposo, quien es artesano y pescador, juntos tiene un hijo. Hace mas de 6 años se dedica en la venta de adornos artesanales, en las cuales ella misma los elabora, como collares y pulsares, hechas en bonitos diseños. Su mercado es en su propio hogar,  lugar donde acuden sus clientes, además le conviene ya que así no descuida de su familia. Por otra parte su trabajo no es tan fácil como parece, pues necesita de gran precisión ya que sus clientes son muy exigentes a la hora de ver el acabado final. Su anhelo es ampliar su negocio, por eso desea tener un pequeño taller donde pueda contratar a más gente para que realice la producción. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y siempre se caracterizó por ser muy responsable con sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales para la elaboración de sus objetos artesanales y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Flor is 28, and she shares her life in her own home with her husband, an artisan and fisherman. Together they have a son. More than 6 years ago she started working selling handcrafted adornments that she produced herself, such as necklaces and bracelets, made in beautiful designs. Her shop is her own home, where her customers come. This is convenient for her since she can take care of her family. Her work is not as easy as it seems; she needs to work with great precision since her customers are very demanding when they come to see the finished product. Her goal is to increase her business, and for this she would like to have a small workshop where she can contract more people to do the work. This is her first loan with MFP and she is always known to be responsible with her payments. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy materials to make her handcrafted pieces and thus increase her production

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make her handcrafted jewelry

loans.name: Dirt Bricks Production Group

texts.en:
Michael I., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called 'Dirt Bricks Production'. He is 54 years old, married, and has two children, 16 and 18 years old. He is a college graduate and his children are attending school. 

For 3 years, he has been molding and selling bricks in the ELWA community, outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 10,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 38,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more brick-molding tools such as shovels and a brick-molding machine.

Michael I. describes himself as a hard-working man. His dream is to expand his business and venture into another business.

loans.use: To buy more brick-molding tools such as shovels and a brick-molding machine

loans.name: Yude

texts.es: Yude, de 25 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de su pareja Humberto (28) y de sus dos pequeños hijos.Desde hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, con lo cual genera un regular  ingreso extra a la economía familiar, pues siempre le ha gustado compartir los gastos con su pareja. Le agrada mucho su trabajo, pues le da la independencia de poder realizarlo desde su casa, y así puede  vigilar a sus pequeños hijos, además que no descuida las labores de su hogar. Ofrece su variada  mercadería por catálogos a sus vecinas y amigas; de esta forma  obtiene buenos pedidos, sobretodo porque recomienda los tonos y productos que mejor le cae a las clientes.  En el futuro espera instalar  un gran bazar donde pueda ofrecer más cómodamente su mercadería.Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y se compromete a  ser muy puntual con sus pagos.Yude tiene planeado invertir  el dinero solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de cosméticos para tenerlos en stock, y ofrecerlos a buenos precios a sus fieles clientes.
texts.en:
Yude, 25, lives in her own house with her partner, Humberto, 28, and their two young children. She has sold beauty products for the last three years. This produces extra income for the family because she has always enjoyed sharing costs with her partner. She enjoys her work very much because it gives her the freedom to work from home so she can watch over her small children; in addition, she doesn’t neglect her household chores. She offers a variety of catalogue items to her neighbors and friends. They place good orders especially because she recommends what hues go best and which products are most appropriate for her customers. In the future, she’d like to set up a large store where she can sell her merchandise more comfortably. This is her 2nd loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with repayments. Yude plans to use the requested funds o buy large amounts of cosmetics to have in stock so that she can offer them at good prices to her best customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Luz Argentina

texts.es:
Luz Argentina C. de 55 años es una persona trabajadora y madre abnegada  que le brindo todo lo que estuvo a alcance a sus cuatro hijos los cuales son mayores de edad. Ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende de todo un poco desde granos básicos, ropa, bisutería, zapatos, chinelas etc.
 
C. invertirá el crédito en surtir su tienda especialmente en comprar quintal de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, maíz, harina, maseca, etc.  El sueño de ella es poder trabajar con su propio capital pero para ello necesita aumentar sus inversiones.
texts.en:
Luz Argentina C., 55, is a hard-working and selfless mother who gave everything she had at to her four children who are now all adults. She has a grocery store where she stocks a bit of everything from basic grains to clothing to costume jewelry to shoes to slippers, etc. C. will use the funds to buy stock items for her store, especially rice, beans, sugar, corn, flour, cornmeal, etc. Her dream is to work with her own capital but to reach that goal she needs to increase her investments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Enye Mahooden Group

texts.en:
Janet is currently the group leader of “Enye Mahooden' (translated as 'not by might') Trust Bank Group made up of 8 members. Janet is clearly a hard worker. She is a 53-year-old woman who is a hairdresser and also sells bales of used clothes to customers in her community. 

Janet has been operating her businesses for 4 years and is eager to be taking out this loan. She plans to invest the loan in buying hair pomade and creams to revive her beauty salon and expend the rest to purchase bales of assorted used clothes to serve her customers. Used clothes are most patronized since brand-new ones are expensive for the majority of low-income people. This has created a market for women like Janet.

Janet is divorced and she is the mother of one child who is 13 years old. Janet’s dreams include owning a kiosk to sell ice creams and ice and selling 'kenkey' (balls of fermented maize dough) to generate additional income to support her child’s education to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To purchase hair creams and used clothes

loans.name: Vilma Liseth

texts.es:
Vilma Lisseth L. L.  en  1992 inicio a  comercializar de manera ambulante ropa, zapatos, prenda y cosmético. Esta señora trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora ha sido beneficiada por Adim tanto por la oferta de crédito como con los programas de desarrollo empresarial  y autonomía personal que le ayudado a  tener mayor  libertad, a conocer y explotar sus capacidades, estar segura de sí misma y administrar su negocio. 
 
Ella invertirá su crédito para adquirir mercadería en ropa, zapatos, prendas, tinte, champú, desodorante, perfumes y con ello levantar las ventas y sus ingresos.
texts.en:
In 1992 Vilma Liseth began selling clothing, shoes, jewelry, and cosmetics in the streets. This hard-working, forceful and enterprising woman has benefited from ADIM, through its offer of credit and its entrepreneurial development and personal autonomy programs, which have helped her to gain more liberty, to know and to explore her capabilities, and to be more sure of herself and better administer her business. Vilma will invest her loan in acquiring merchandise, including clothing, shoes, jewelry, hair coloring, shampoo, deodorant, and perfumes, and with all that to elevate her sales and income.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: ACQUIRE MERCHANDISE, INCLUDING CLOTHING, SHOES, JEWELRY, AND COSMETICS TO SELL

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es: Augusto, de  53 años, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos.Desde hace 6 años, se dedica a la venta de baterías para autos, en un pequeño local ubicado dentro de un taller mecánico. Como estudio  mecánica, esto le brinda la ventaja de aconsejar a sus clientes sobre los productos que ofrece, pues conoce del tema.  Le gusta  mucho su trabajo y le dedica prácticamente todo el día, solo descansa para su refrigerio, y como  tiene clientes fijos, que le compran de vez en cuando las baterías, para sus movilidades, obtiene regulares ganancias. En el futuro se proyecta a instalar su negocio  en la avenida principal, para hacerlo más vistoso, pues ahora siente que esta algo  escondido, al estar dentro del taller de autos.Es el segundo préstamo que tiene  con MFP, y siempre se ha caracterizado  por ser muy responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.Augusto tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  cantidad de baterías para abastecer a sus clientes y de esta manera busca mejorar sus ingresos, para seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Augusto, 53, lives in his own house with his wife and two children. For the past 6 years he has sold car batteries in a small locale located in a machine shop. Because he trained as a mechanic he has the advantage of being able to advise his customers regarding the products he offers because he’s versed in the topic. He enjoys his work very much and spends most of the day at it; he only rests to take in some refreshment. Because he has regular customers that buy vehicle batteries from him occasionally, he has a steady income. In the future, he would like to set up his shop on the main avenue so that it will be more visible because he now feels it’s a bit hidden away being inside a car repair shop. This is his 2nd loan with MFP and he has always been very responsible with respect to repayments. Augusto plans to use the requested funds to buy a quantity of batteries to supply his customers thereby seeking to improve his income in order to continue to progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy batteries to stock his shop.

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 40 años de edad, comparte su vida con Rodolfo de 42 años y sus hijos Rubén de 12 años y Dayat de 5 años. Juntos viven en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica es la elaboración y venta de prendas tejidas a mano, lo cual le da los ingresos necesarios para compartir con su esposo los gastos de su hogar. Desde muy niña ella aprendió esta labor de su madre, quien con mucha paciencia le enseñó lo secretos para realizar un buen tejido, hoy en día pone en práctica para darle los últimos acabados a sus prendas. María trabaja realizando los tejidos por pedidos, la ventaja de vivir en una zona, donde su cultura se caracteriza por ser buenos tejedores, eso le ha dado la ventaja para este arte en un trabajo muy rentable. En un futuro desea seguir trabajando muy duro para tener su propio taller, además de comprarse máquinas tejedoras. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP, por tanto se ha comprometido ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará materiales, como: lana, agujas nuevas para poder continuar tejiendo y así aumentar su producción.
texts.en:
Maria is 40 years old and shares her life with Rodolfo who is 42, and her children, Ruben, 12, and Dayat, 5. Together they live in her own house. Her work is to elaborate and sell decorative garments woven by hand. This provides the necessary income to contribute with her husband to household costs. From a very young age, she learned this skill from her mother, who with much patience taught her the secrets of realizing good weaving. Today she puts into practice these techniques to achieve a high quality of goods. Maria does weaving by request, taking advantage of residing in a zone where the culture leads one to be a good weaver. This has given her an advantage in this art; the work is very profitable. In the future, she wants to work very hard to have her own workshop, and in addition, to buy weaving machines. This is Maria's 6th loan with MFP, and she has committed herself to being very punctual in all her payments. With the loan she solicits, Maria will buy supplies, including wool and new needles, in order to continue weaving and in this manner, to augment her production.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING WOOL AND NEW NEEDLES FOR WEAVING

loans.name: Juliana Ricarda

texts.es:
Juliana Ricarda Martínez de 58 años  se dedica al comercio de cosméticos de manera ambulante en Siuna municipio de la Región Autónoma Atlántico Norte. Ella viaja con regularidad y por largos periodos desde hace diez años ya que Siuna se encuentra una distancia de  318 Kms de Managua.

Ella invertirá el crédito en la compra de gran parte de la mercadería que lleva y otra en el transporte.
texts.en:
Juliana Ricarda Martínez is 58 years old and works in traveling cosmetics sales in Siuna, a town in the Autonomous North-Atlantic Region. She has traveled regularly and for large periods for ten years, since Siuna is found 318 Kms away from Managua. She will invest the loan in the purchase largely of the merchandise she carries, and the rest in transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cosmetics

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala lives with her husband and children in Multan, Pakistan. She is a housewife who plays her role by taking care of her family, staying at home. Her husband operates a canteen in a school. He wants some more refreshment materials for his canteen. 

Ghazala has applied for a loan to financially support her husband in expanding his canteen business. She hopes that it will increase his income and their family will be able to have a better life, financially speaking.

loans.use: Purchase eatable items for canteen business

loans.name: Martha Leonor

texts.es: Martha Leonor T. M. inicio en el 2010 con la venta de tajadas con queso, tortas de papa, enchiladas actualmente ha ido surtiendo su negocio con la comercialización de carne asada, cerdo asado, pollo asado y frito, gallopinto, ensaladas, tajadas etc. Ella con el préstamo piensa seguir mejorando su negocio y crecer.
texts.en:
In 2010, Martha Leonor T. M. began selling plantains with cheese, potato cakes, and enchiladas. At the moment, she has increased her business by selling roasted beef, roasted pork, roasted and fried chicken, beans and rice, salads, plantain chips, and other items.

With this loan, Martha plans to continue improving and growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains, vegetables, and other ingredients

loans.name: Roberth

texts.es: Roberth tiene 24 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y piensa en progresar y tener un buen futuro, vive en casa de su hermana con sus sobrinos. Gracias a su gran iniciativa y creatividad con el trabajo se las ingenió para lograr ingresos extras, es así que teniendo un negocio con su hermana, que es dar servicio de Internet, por lo que cuenta con cabinas personales. Paralelamente a esto, colocó un play station, actividad que el está generando más ingresos económicos. Además de ello, durante las mañanas tiene otro oficio, en una empresa de teléfonos, donde le mantiene ocupado durante todo el día. En un futuro desea seguir mejorando su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de computadoras y play stations y así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser muy puntual con todos sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará CD con contenido de los últimos juegos de play station, así como otro play station para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Roberth is 24 years old. He is a hardworking gentleman who thinks about making progress and having a good future. Roberth lives at home with his sister and his nephews. Thanks to his great initiative and creativity, he is able to generate extra income. Roberth and his sister have a business providing Internet service by renting out individual computer stations. At the same time, they installed a PlayStation console to create more revenue. Roberth also has a job working for the telephone company, which keeps him busy all day. In the future, he wants to continue improving his business by purchasing more computers and PlayStation consoles to generate more income.

This is his second loan with MFP. Roberth has always been known for being prompt with all of his payments. The loan he requested will be used to buy a video game CD containing the latest PlayStation games, as well as another PlayStation console in order to earn more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a video game CD and a PlayStation console

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
la sra, Blanca Rosa C. O. tiene 67 años de edad, vive en la colonia San Miguel de la Ciudad Capital, Blanca se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene poco tiempo de tener su negocio el cual le genera ingresos para cubrir sus gastos personales. Blanca es una persona de la tercera edad, esta es su unica fuente de ingresos, nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que este negocio hace sentirse activa y no estar sentada sin hacer nada todo el dia, blanca es una mujer muy trabajadora pero a su edad ya no puede hacer mucho.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mas variedad de productos y mas surtida su pulperia.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir sus gastos como ser alimentacion, vestuario y vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca Rosa C. O. is 67 years old and lives in the San Miguel neighborhood of the capital city of Tegucigalpa. She sells popular consumer products. Blanca has managed her business for a short period of time and started it so that she could generate income to cover her personal expenses. Since she is a senior citizen, this is her only source of income. Blanca says she is happy with this business because it keeps her active and prevents her from doing nothing all day. Despite being a hardworking woman, she is not able to do much at her age.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise so that she can have a wider variety of products and a well-stocked store. The income that she needs will go toward covering expenses such as food, clothing, and shelter.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es: La  solicitante es casada, trabaja en granja y con los ahorros compraron un auto que su esposo lo maneja. El destino del credito es para comprar el sistema de conversion a gas, lo que le permitira reducir los gastos en consumo de combustible.
texts.en:
Rosalinda is married and works on a farm. Using her savings, she bought a car for her husband to drive. This loan will be used to convert the vehicle to a natural gas system, which will help reduce fuel costs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Convert her husband's vehicle to a natural gas system

loans.name: Jackqueline

texts.es: Jackqueline, de  36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, en su casa que es propia.Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica, desde hace 3 años, a la venta de  granos como maíz, cebada, alverja, habas y quinua de sus propias cosechas, al por mayor y menor,  y también comercializa lo que compra a sus vecinos. Además cría vacas, y comercializa la leche que producen, todos los miércoles y fines de semana, es por ello que siempre esta al pendiente de los precios  de la leche y de los granos, porque de eso dependen sus ganancias. Los frutos de su dedicado trabajo siempre le generan ganancias para el bienestar de su familia, y su deseo es producir en gran escala los granos y llegar a ser una comerciante mayorista.Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y promete que  será  muy responsable con sus pagos, además agradece  a todas las personas que hicieron posible el préstamo que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio.Jackqueline tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono que necesita para sus siembras de maíz y también comprará una vaca joven. El crédito cubre la mitad de lo que desea adquirir, ya que la otra parte será cubierta de sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Jackqueline is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. For the past three years, she has worked hard to grow corn, barley, peas, beans, and quinoa and sell them wholesale and at retail. Jackqueline also buys crops from her neighbors to sell. In addition, she raises cows and sells the milk that they produce every Wednesday and on the weekends to generate revenue. The fruits of her labor have always resulted in income for her family’s welfare. Jackqueline wants to produce grain on a larger scale so that she can become a commercial wholesaler.

This is the second time she has received a loan from MFP. Jackqueline promises to be prompt with her payments and thanks everyone who made this loan possible since it will be very useful in advancing her business. She has plans to invest the money in sacks of compost needed for her corn crop. In addition, she will buy a young cow. The loan will cover half the cost of what she wants to acquire, so she will use her savings to pay for the other half.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & a young cow

loans.name: Maria Rosario

texts.es:
La  señora Maria Rosario L. se dedica a la Elaboracion y Venta de Golosinas, misma que se encuentra ubicada en su casa de habitacion en la  Colonia San Jose de la Vega, en un punto muy estrategico ya que transitan muchas personas por este sector,  su negocio lleva el nombre de GOLOSINAS LOS ALMENDROS, cuenta con 27 años de
experiencia, realiza sus ventas de Martes a Domingo con un horario de 5:00 PM a 10:00 PM. Entre la variedad de su menu se encuentra las Tortas, Pan con Carne, tortillas con quesillo, tacos. todo es muy delicioso. Chayito como es comunmente que la llamen sus clientes es una mujer muy trabajadora, gracias a su negocio y al
esfuerzo de todos los dias, ha logrado pagarle el estudio a sus hijos, esta casada su esposo es comerciante y su mayor sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
el credito lo utilizara para la construccion de un mueble de cocina y remodelar su cocina para que sea mas aseada y que tenga mejor presentacion y asi poder hacer mejor sus comidas. todo esto es para darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes en la elaboracion de las golosinas.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario L. makes and sells snacks from her home in the San Jose de la Vega neighborhood, which is a strategic area since many people pass through this neighborhood. Her business is named "Golosinas Los Almendros." She has 27 years of experience in this business, selling from Tuesdays through Sundays on a schedule from 5pm until 10pm. Among the items on her menu are tortas (sandwiches), bread with meat, tortilla with cheese, and tacos, and everything is very delicious. Chayito, as her customers call her, is a hardworking woman. Thanks to her business and her daily efforts, she has managed to pay for the education of her children. She is married, and her husband is a merchant. Her main dream is to have her business grow and improve the quality of her life. This loan will be used to build kitchen cabinets and remodel her kitchen so that it will be neater and look better, and so that she can improve the quality of her food. This will allow her to provide better service for her customers in her snack-making business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tile, paint sand and adhesive

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Wencelada

texts.es:
La Sra. Wencelada G. de 51 años de edad es vendedora de artículos  de almacén, ella es muy conocida en la zona de Villarrica. Tiene un hijo mayor de edad quien les ayuda en el reparto del producto. Empezó hace mas de 1 año con la ayuda de su pareja el Sr. Pedro G., quien trabaja haciendo fletes en la zona del mercado de la ciudad, cuenta con un carrito y un caballo.

Solicito dicho préstamo para la  compra de carbón en grandes cantidades, ya que estamos en la temporada de frío y es cuando aumentan los pedidos del producto; así como bolsas más pequeñas de diferentes pesos y así con su mayor distribución incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Wencelada G., 51 years old, sells basic household items for a living, and she is very well-known in the zone of Villarrica. She has an older son, who helps in the distribution of her products. She began this business over one year ago with the help of her partner, Mr. Pedro G., who works doing deliveries in the commercial zone of the city. They have a small car and a horse. Wencelada is applying for this loan to buy charcoal wholesale in large quantities, because it is already the cold season, and this is when the requests for this product increase. She wishes to buy smaller bags of charcoal of varying weights, and increase her income by selling these through her excellent distribution system.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wholesale items for retail sale, such as large bags of charcoal to split up and sell in smaller quantities.

loans.name: Tasleem Zahra's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem Zahra lives with her husband in Multan. Her husband operates a bicycle shop. Tasleem does embroidery work to help her husband to meet family expenses. She is also a very good housewife who takes care of her home very well. 

Her husband wants to expand his business and wants to buy bicycle spare parts and new bicycles as well. Tasleem has applied for a loan for her husband who with the help of loan assistance will be able to offer the latest and branded bicycle parts and bicycles to his clients. 

Tasleem hopes that this investment will make her husband’s business to grow and also increase their household income.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts & bicycles

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina runs her boutique at her home. She uses a room for this work because she can’t pay the high rent for a shop. She takes orders from nearby areas and fulfills them to earn an income. She lives in a city called Multan which is famous for its sweetmeats and clothes in Pakistan. 

Zarina has always wanted to promote her talent of making embroidered clothes. God has given her the opportunity to display her work to people in her boutique. Her work has become the major source of generating income for her family.  

Zarina is looking to expand her business to generate even more income. Therefore, she has applied for a loan to buy more embroidery materials and to buy more variety of clothes.  She hopes that in this way she can help her family to have a better life, financially speaking.

loans.use: Purchase embroidery materials and clothes for her boutique

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
La señora Teodora D. 42 años D. edad es comerciante, se dedica a la venta D. calzados para damas  caballeros y niños su puesto D. ventas se encuentra en el mercado municipal D. la ciudad D. Villarrica desD. hace mas D. 20 años, le ayuda su conyuge el señor Eustacio O. D. 55 años D. edad.

Comenta que empezó con poca mercadería y con el trabajo y el esfuerzo D. ellos pudieron salir adelante y ampliar su negocio, mediante el ingreso del negocio pueden cubrir todos los gastos familiares en cuanto a educacion y alimentación principalmente. 

Solicita el préstamo a Fundación Paraguaya para la  compra D. más mercaderías D. la temporada como calzados para damas, caballeros y niños ademas desaen comprar para ampliar su negocio medias, buzos, camperas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teodora is 42 years old and is a businesswoman; she sells footwear for women, men, and children. Her sales stall has been in the Villarrica municipal market for over 20 years. Her 55-year-old husband, Mr. Eustacio O., helps her with her business. She tells us that she began with few products, but with the work and effort she and her husband put into the business, they were able to come out ahead and grow. Through the income that they maD. from the daily sales of footwear, they were able to cover all of their family’s basic expenses. Teodora is applying for a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya to buy more goods for this season, such as different types of footwear, sweaters, socks and stockings, sweatshirts, and jackets to satisfy her customers’ demand.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of shoes, athletic footwear, socks, etc. for the winter season

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
