Los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, lo invertirá tanto en sus cafetales, comprando fertilizantes y en abastecer su bodega con diversos productos.
texts.en:
Nelly is 29 years old. She is a single mother, who is responsible and very hardworking. She lives in her own house with her two children - Junior (11) and Noelia (6) - to whom she wants to offer a better quality of life. She gets up very early every morning to water and look after her coffee plants. She also has a shop, which she succeeded in opening through considerable effort. What she likes most about her job is working for herself on her own land. She has been growing crops for ten years. What she finds most difficult is working the land. In time, she would like to purchase more land and increase the amount she grows. This is the second loan Nelly has requested from MFP. She knows the loan will help her alot in developing her business and, for this reason, is committed to making all her payments on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal group, which cares for her greatly. The two thousand soles that she has requested will be invested in looking after her coffee plants, buying fertilisers and stocking her shop with various products.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilisers for her coffee plants and products for her shop

loans.name: Maria Segunda

texts.es:
Maria Segunda M. O. tiene 60 años de edad. Es casada y vive con su esposo en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 5 hijos: Rebeca (31), Néstor (26), Clemencia (25), Bélgica (22) y Cecilia (20), 
Maria es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Maria trabaja en la agricultura. Cultiva maíz y un poco de arbejas para el consumo de la familia. Hace las compras en San Pablo y las ventas en el terreno a los comerciantes. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos y semillas.  Dice que el crédito le ayudara a mejorar la calidad de la semilla. Su sueño es comprar un lote de terreno para construir su casa. Los desafíos que ella enfrenta son la sequía y las enfermedades y plagas que atacan a los cultivos.  

Le gusta pasar tiempo en las fiestas espirituales con los amigos y la familia, y en sus ratos libres ir de visita donde sus hijos, que no viven en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Segunda M. O. is 60 years old. She is married and lives with her husband in the canton of San Miguel, Bolívar Province. She has 5 children: Rebeca (31), Néstor (26), Clemencia (25), Bélgica (22) and Cecilia (20). Maria is a member of the Santiagopamba rural bank in San Pablo, which is half an hour from the town of San Miguel. The majority of the bank's members work in agriculture as a source of income for their families. Maria works in agriculture. She grows corn and some peas for her own family. She purchases her produce in San Pablo and sells it to merchants. Droughts, plant disease and insect plagues are a challenge. She has requested the loan to buy fertilisers and seeds. The loan will help her to improve the quality of the seeds. Her dream is to buy a plot of land to build a house. She enjoys spending her time at spiritual festivals with her friends and family. She likes to spend her free time visiting her children, who do not live locally.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilisers and seeds

loans.name: Néstor Fabián

texts.es:
Néstor Fabián P. A. tiene 23 años de edad. Vive con su esposa e hija de 2 meses, Neyda, en el cantón de San Miguel, en la provincia de Bolívar.

Néstor es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Néstor estudia y trabaja en la agricultura. Realiza las compras de sus productos en San Pablo y las ventas a los comerciantes en el terreno. 

Solicita el préstamo para comprar abonos para sus sembrios. Piensa que el crédito le ayudará para poder sacar mejores productos al mercado. Su sueño seria mejorar su situación económica para vivir bien con su familia. 

Enfrenta desafíos como enfermedades que atacan a los cultivos. 

Le gusta hacer deportes en su tiempo libre como jugar voleibol, y las fiestas tradicionales como carnaval, donde se reunía todo la familia.
texts.en:
Néstor Fabián P. A. is 23 years of age. He lives with his wife and daughter of 2 months, Neyda, in the village of San Miguel, in the province of Bolívar. Néstor is a member of the Santiagopamba rural assocation, which is located in San Pablo, half an hour from the town of San Miguel. The group is composed of people that are mostly dedicated to agriculture as the source of income for their family. Néstor attends school and works in agriculture. He purchases his products in San Pablo and sells them to the merchants in the surrounding area. He requests a loan to buy fertilizer for his crops. He thinks that the credit will help to be able to bring better products to the market. He would like to improve his economic situation and to live well with his family. He faces challenges such as diseases that attack his crops. He likes to play sports in his free time, such as volleyball, and attend the traditional festivals like carnival, where the whole family meets.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Fanny Cesible

texts.es:
Fanny Cesible A. M. tiene 30 años de edad. Es casada y vive con su esposo y 4 hijos, Amanda (13), Shirley (11), Jhinson (9) y Thalia (7) en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.  

Fanny es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Fanny trabaja en la agricultura. Lo que mas siembra son maíz, papas y legumbres. Hace las compras y ventas en el mercado de Guaranda (a una hora de San Pablo). 

Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos y sembrar papas. Piensa que el préstamo le ayudará a poner más abonos en las siembras para producir más. Su sueño es comprar un pequeño terreno para aumentar la producción. Enfrenta plagas y enfermedades a los cultivos.

Le gusta salir de paseo con su familia y las costumbres del carnaval que se celebra cada año en Febrero.
texts.en:
Fanny Cesible A. M. is 30 years of age. She is married and lives with her husband and 4 children, Amanda (13), Shirley (11), Jhinson (9) and Thalia (7) in the village of San Miguel in the province of Bolívar. Fanny is a member of the Santiagopamba rural associatoin, which is found in San Pablo, half an hour from the town of San Miguel. The group is composed of people that are mostly dedicated to agriculture as the source of income of their family. Fanny works in agriculture. Her largest crops are corn, potatoes and vegetables. She does the buying and selling in the market of Guaranda (an hour from San Pablo). She requests the loan to buy supplies and to sow potatoes. She thinks that the loan will help her to put more fertilizer on her crops to produce more. Her dream is to buy a small plot of land to enlarge her production. She faces plagues and diseases in her crops. She likes to go on walks with her family and enjoy the customs of the carnival that is held each year in February.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to sow potatoes.

loans.name: Felicitas Susana

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 64 años y tiene 1 hija que estudia en la universidad, Felicitas viaja a las ferias D. la región 3 veces por semana en donD. venD. ropa variada y D. las ferias compra quesos que venden en las diferentes tiendas, la ropa lo compra D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho y en algunas oportunidades D. la ciudad D. Lima.
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Diamantes y necesita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra D. ropa típica, como mandiles y fustanes.
Felicitas sueña con tener una tienda D. ropa e implementar un Internet.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 64 years old and has 1 daughter who studies at the university. Felicitas travels to the outdoor markets of the region 3 times each week where she sells various types of clothing and buys cheeses that she resells to the different stores. She buys the clothes in the city of Ayacucho and in some cases in the city of Lima. Felicitas is an associate of the Diamonds Communal Bank. She needs a loan that will be invested in the purchase of traditional clothing, like aprons and petticoats. Felicitas dreams of having a clothing store and an Internet site.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy traditional clothing, such as aprons and petticoats.

loans.name: Rosa Magdalena

texts.es:
Rosa Magdalena A. C. tiene 19 años, es soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de San Miguel en la provincia de Bolívar.

Rosa es un miembro de la ventanilla rural Santiagopamba, que se encuentra en San Pablo, a media hora del pueblo de San Miguel. La ventanilla esta compuesta por personas que en su mayoría se dedica a la agricultura, como fuente de ingresos de su familia.

Rosa trabaja en el negocio de legumbres y estudia al mismo tiempo. Compra en los mercados de Riobamba (a más de 3 horas de distancia) y vende en Chillanes (a más de una hora de distancia). 
 
Solicita el préstamo para invertir en el negocio y algo para los estudios. El crédito le ayudara a aumentar el negocio. Su meta es terminar sus estudios y seguir con el negocio. Enfrenta desafíos como la competencia y los productos que están muy caros. 

Le gustan fiestas del mercado en Chillanes y jugar fútbol.
texts.en:
Rosa Magdalena A. C. is 19 years old, and she is single. She lives with her parents in the San Miguel canton in the Bolívar province. Rosa is a member of the Santiagopamba Communal Bank, which is a half hour from the town of San Miguel. The communal bank is mostly made up of people who devote themselves to agriculture as the main source of income for their families. Rosa works in the vegetable business, and she goes to school at the same time. She buys in the Riobamba markets (over three hours away), and she sells in Chillanes (over one hour away). She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. She will use some of it for her education. The loan will help her increase her business. Her goal is to finish her studies and to continue with the business. The challenges that face her are the competition and that the products are very expensive. She likes the festivals in the Chillanes market, and she likes to play soccer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in her business, and part of the loan for her education

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es una madre de familia de 44 años de edad que vive junto a su familia y a sus hijos en el distrito de Olmos, el distrito con la extensión territorial mas grande de la región Lambayeque, está conformado por un pueblo central y por varios caseríos que distan mucho uno del otro. Pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de dos años a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece todo tipo de productos a sus clientes, los cuales prefieren su negocio por la calidad de productos y por el buen trato que suele ofrecer. Esta actividad es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia, por este motivo ella trata de dar lo mejor de si para sacarla adelante.

Carmen desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, de modo que pueda incrementar sus ventas y percibir mas ganancias, por ese motivo ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer bastante responsable y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carmen, 44, lives with her family and children in Olmos district which is the largest district in Lambayeque region; it is made up of a central town surrounded by several settlements that are quite distant from one another. It is part of Lambayeque province and is located an hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over two years she has sold basic needs items in a grocery store located in her home. She offers a variety of items to her customers who prefer her store thanks to the quality of the products and the good customer service she provides. This activity is an important source of family income so she gives it her best to help it succeed. Carmen would like to expand her business buying more products so that her sales will increase and her profits will be higher. She is, therefore, asking for her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 new soles to help her reach this goal. She is quite a responsible and hard-working woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman to provide her family with a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia pertenece al Banco Comunal Diamantes, es casada tiene 38 años y 2 hijos que estudian, Sonia hace manualidades a crochet, como costureros, adornos de cocina, de acuerdo al pedido de sus clientes. Además vende ropa a pedido que ofrece a amigos y familiares, productos que le envía su hermana. También Sonia vende ollas renaware por catálogos. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de polos. Sonia estudio cosmetología y sueña con implementar un salón de belleza en donde también venda sus productos.
texts.en:
Sonia, 38, is married and has two children who are students; she’s a member of the Diamantes (Diamonds) communal bank. Sonia makes crochet crafts such as sewing baskets and kitchen decorations on order. She also sells clothing on order to friends and relatives; her sister sends her the merchandise. In addition, Sonia sells Rena Ware brand pots by catalogue. She will use the funds to buy polo-type shirts. Sonia studied cosmetology and her dream is to set up a beauty salon where she can also sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shirts.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela, de 37 años, es madre soltera y  tiene 5 hijos, pero solo  vive con 4 de ellos, en su casa que es propia.Es una mujer emprendedora porque para sacar adelante a sus hijos, vende cerveza y bebidas gasificadas, además prepara comida para vender en su restaurante turístico. Como si fuera poco paralelamente cría decenas de patos y gallinas que enseba para vender y también para preparar sus potajes. Daniela cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos, por eso el negocio le resulta rentable, pues no tiene que pagar a terceras personas, y su espíritu emprendedor hace que piense en instalar una granja muy amplia, para que pueda vender al por mayor. En la actualidad está a la espera de las decenas de cuyes que pidió a una negociante de otra ciudad, y orgullosa cuenta “críe 120 gallinas, las hice crecer desde muy tiernas y las comercialice cada una a 35 soles, por eso estoy segura que este negocio me resultará muy beneficioso”, concluye.Esta es la séptima vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su banco comunal, le gusta trabajar de manera organizada y siempre velando por el bienestar del resto de integrantes.Daniela tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra  de  insumos necesarios para continuar preparando comida, además adquirirá  cerveza, bebidas gasificadas y algunas golosinas.
texts.en:
Daniela is a 37-year old single mother. She has five children, but she lives with only four of them in her home, which she owns. She is an enterprising woman who helps her children advance by selling beer and soft drinks in addition to preparing food to sell in her tourist restaurant. If it were possible, she would also raise and sell ducks and hens and use them in her stews. Daniela counts on the help of her children, and because of this, her business is very profitable, since she doesn't have to pay any third-parties. Her enterprising spirit has led her to think about installing a large poultry farm so she can begin selling wholesale. Currently, she is awaiting an order of ten giunea pigs from a businessman in another city. Proudly, she says, "I raised 120 hens, from very young, and sold them for 35 Soles each. This is why I am sure that this business will greatly benefit me." .

This is the 7th time that she has taken a loan with MFP, and since she already knows the work methods of her community bank, she likes to work in an organized manner and always ensures the well-being of the rest of the members. Daniela plans to invest the money she seeks in the purchase of the supplies she needs to continue preparing foods, and serving beer, soft drinks, and some sweets.

Translated from Spanish by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients and soft drinks

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El Sr. R. P. Juan Carlos, vive en la venta baja  perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene a cargo a su esposa y a sus dos hijos. Trabaja como obrero de campo en la parcela  de la Sra. Lilia Huamani desde hace 2 años. Vive en casa de sus padres a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para apoyar con la realización de los acabados de la vivienda de sus padres. Su sueño es poder terminar de construir su vivienda a fin de poder brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El Sr. R. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Carlos R. P. lives in the district of Santiago. He provides for his wife and their two children. He has worked as a farm laborer on the land of Mrs. Lilia Huamani for the past 2 years. He lives in his parents' home, which is currently being remodeled. He is asking for a loan to help with the remodeling projects of his parents' house. His dream is to be able to finish building his house to be able to provide a better quality of life for his family. Mr. R. is grateful for the support that we can provide him through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 33 años, es una carismática y atenta mujer, está casada con Ever de 38 años, juntos tienen 4 hijos y viven en su casa propia, que se encuentra ubicada en una zona turística de la ciudad de “La Merced”. Desde dulces hasta prendas de vestir, se puede encontrar en la tienda de Norma, que es una de las tiendas muy bien surtidas. Paralelo a ello prepara comida y la ofrece a las personas quienes trabajan en los campos agrícolas, mientras su esposo, labora como ayudante panadero y en su tiempo libre la ayuda en su puesto de comida, atendiendo a sus clientes. Lleva 3 años dedicada a estos oficios y confiesa que más le gusta hacer compras observando la necesidad de sus consumidores y hasta distingue marcas y precios. Considera que su actividad es muy rentable porque le genera ganancias considerables, en donde lo administra e invierte en aras de ampliar su bodega hasta poder vender al por mayor y menor. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP y está agradecida con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes son muy responsables y unidos ya que le permiten seguir accediendo a créditos que le facilitan su progreso. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará productos de primera necesidad y comestibles, así como bebidas alcohólicas y gasificadas.
texts.en:
Norma, age 33, is a charismatic and thoughtful woman. She is married to Ever, who is 38. They have four children, and they live in their own house. It is located in a tourist area in the city of La Merced. You can find things from sweets to clothing in Norma’s store. It is one of the stores that is very well stocked. She also prepares food and sells it to the people who work in the fields. Her husband works as a baker’s assistant. In his time off he helps her with her food stand by waiting on her customers. She has been doing these jobs for three years. She says that what she likes the most is making purchases according to her observations about her customers’ needs, brands, and prices. She thinks that this activity is very profitable because it generates considerable earnings. She manages the income and invests it in order to expand her store until she is able to sell for retail and wholesale. This is her third loan with MFP. She is grateful to the members of her communal bank. They are very responsible and united. They allow her to continue to get loans, which facilitate her progress. She will use the requested loan to buy basic needs products, food, and other things such as alcoholic drinks and soft drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products such as basic needs products and soft drinks

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely es conviviente, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Nelly hace 1 año tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días. Además Nely los días domingos vende mondongo en su misma casa, antes de que naciera su hijo que tiene 1 mes vendía cebiche todos los días, actividad que dejo de realizar por su hijo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite.
Nely es socia del Banco Comunal Diamantes y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro.
Nely sueña con mejorar su casa, darle un acabado y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nelly, 32, lives with her life partner and their two children. A year ago she set up a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries and vegetables daily. In addition, on Sundays she sells mondongo [a hearty traditional soup of Latin America and the Caribbean. It is made from slow-cooked diced tripe (the cleaned stomach of a cow). Vegetables such as bell peppers, onions, carrots, cabbage, celery, tomatoes, cilantro, garlic or root vegetables are added] from home. Before her son, who is a month old, was born she sold cebiche (marinated fish) every day but she stopped this activity due to her son. She will use the funds to buy rice, sugar, milk and cooking oil. Nely is a member of the Diamantes (Diamonds) communal bank and what she likes most is the savings incentives. Nely dreams with making some home improvements, to complete its finishing touches and with providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, milk and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Va a utilizarlo en su casa de habitación cambio de Techo compra de Perlines y Zinc

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es casada, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Nelly tiene un cafetín en el Colegio Condorcanqui en donde vende golosinas, comida, negocio que realiza hace 5 años con la ayuda de su esposo. Además Nelly vende salchipollos de manera ambulatoria en el arco de Carmen Alto.
Nelly pertenece al Banco Comunal Florecer y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, azúcar y golosinas.
Los sueños de Nelly son educar a sus hijos y tener un carro para que trabaje su esposo.
texts.en:
Nelly, 31, is married and has two children. She has a small snack bar at Condorcanqui School where she sells snacks and food. She has been in this business with her husband’s help for 5 years. In addition, Nelly sells salchipollos (fried potatoes with fried, shredded chicken) at the Carmen Alto Arch. Nelly’s a member of the Florecer (To Bloom) communal bank and she’s asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy rice, cooking oil, sugar and sweets. Nelly’s dreams are to provide an education for her children and to have a car that her husband can operate.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, sugar and snack items.

loans.name: Yovana

texts.es:
Yovana pertenece al Banco Comunal Florecer, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos que están estudiando, Yovana tiene una tienda en su casa hace 4 años, en donde vende abarrotes en general, gaseosas, helados, recargas, su negocio ha crecido poco a poco, Yovana abre su tienda todos los días. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de recargas telefónicas y tarjetas.
Yovana sueña con terminar de pagar su préstamo con el cual construyo su casa y educar a sus hijos para que sean mejores que ella.
texts.en:
Yovana, 31, is a member of the Florecer (To Bloom) communal bank; she has two children who are students. For the past 4 years she has had a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries, soft-drinks, frozen treats, pre-paid phone cards; her business has been gradually growing. She is open for business every day and plans to use the loan to buy pre-paid phone cards. Yovana dreams with paying off her home construction loan and to provide an education for her children so that they will be better than her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pre-paid phone cards.

loans.name: Edda

texts.es:
Edda es casada, tiene 45 años y 4 hijos, Edda teje chompas de acuerdo a pedidos de sus clientes, sus tejidos los realiza a mano, para tejer una chompa se demora 3 días, sus ventas los realiza también a tiendas. Además Edda por las tarde ayuda a su hija en la atención de un restaurante.
Edda pertenece al Banco Comunal Florecer y solicita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales para poner piso en su casa, porque su sueño es implementar un recreo.
texts.en:
Edda, 45, is married and has 4 children. She hand knits sweaters to order for her customers; it takes her three days to complete one. She also sells to stores. In addition, during the afternoon Edda helps her daughter run a restaurant. Edda is a member of the Florecer (To Bloom) communal bank and she is asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy building materials and supplies to install flooring in her house because her dream is to install a patio.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nancy Esperanza

texts.es:
Nancy pertenece al Banco Comunal Florecer y durante este tiempo los préstamos le ayudaron mucho en su negocio.
Nancy es casada y tiene 2 hijos, Nancy trabaja en una institución como secretaria y estudia contabilidad, Nancy junto a su esposo tienen 2 carros que viajan a la provincia de Vilcas Huaman, cuenta con la ayuda de un chofer. Además Nancy tiene una tienda en Vilcashuaman que esta administrada por hermana, ella le envía la mercadería semanalmente. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y para la reparación de su carro.
Nancy sueña con comprar otro carro y terminar de estudiar su carrera.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Florecer Comunal Bank. The loans she has received through her membership have helped her a great deal with her business. Nancy is married and has two children. She works as a secretary in a company and studies accounting. Nancy and her husband have two cars and travel to the province of Vilcas Huaman with the help of a driver. In addition, Nancy has a store in Vilcas Huaman which her sister manages. She sends her merchandise weekly. Her loan will be used to buy rice and sugar, and to repair her car. Nancy dreams of buying another car and completing her university courses.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar and repair her car.

loans.name: Victoria Isabel

texts.es:
Victoria sueña con terminar sus estudios de contabilidad, Victoria es soltera y vive con sus padres, trabaja en una clínica como enfermería técnica, Victoria viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende abarrotes en general, y de las ferias compra cereales que luego los procesa y los vende en los mercados. Además se dedica a la crianza de cerdos en su casa.
Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar y para los alimentos para los cerdos.   
Victoria sueña con construir su casa.
texts.en:
Victoria dreams of finishing her studies in accounting. Victoria is single and lives with her parents. She works in a clinic as a nursing technician. Victoria travels to the different fairs of the region where she sells groceries and buys grains that she later processes and sells in the markets. She also raises pigs in her home. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar, and for the purchase of pig food. She dreams of building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchsae of rice, sugar and pig food

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin, de 33 años, convive con su pareja Rosa (24), con quien tiene una pequeña hija. Juntos  viven en una casa alquilada. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, y  ahora con mayor razón pues, su motivación diaria es la nueva familia que está conformando. Cada día sale a las 5 de la mañana a trabajar en una tienda comercial, donde vende  productos comestibles, en asociación con su tío. A diario le pagan de 20 a 22 soles, también por trasladar la mercadería, desde la ciudad hasta otra localidad, donde está ubicada la bodega. Además atiende a los clientes y eso es lo que más le gusta, porque considera que tiene un trato especial, ya lleva trabajando 3 años en este negocio, mientras su pareja labora preparado comida, junto a su madre. Esta joven pareja tiene planeado, para más adelante, empezar con su propio centro comercial, y empezaran  por instalar una tienda, ya  que esta actividad es muy rentable, si se sabe administrar bien el dinero.Es  la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y quiere pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas porque, refiere que está haciéndose conocido por tener un buen historial crediticio y eso le importa mucho, al igual que al resto de integrantes de su banco comunal, con quienes les gusta trabajar.Edwin tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado, en la compra de  insumos necesarios para que su esposa continúe preparando comida, y así  generarse más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Edwin, 33 years old, lives with his partner Rosa (24), with whom he has a small daughter. They live in a rented house. He is known as a hard working man, now with more reason, as he is motivated daily by his new family. He leaves every day at 5 in the morning to work in a commercial store where he sells food products with his uncle. Additionally he makes 20 to 25 soles daily, transporting the merchandise from the city to another locality where the general store is located. He also takes care of the customers, which is what he likes the best, he believes that he has a good sales manner after being in this business for 3 years. His spouse works at preparing food with her mother. This young couple has plans in the future of having their own business by opening a store, since this activity is profitable if one know how to manage the money. This is the third loan with MFP and he wants to be punctual with his payments because he is getting to be known as having a good credit history, which is important to him as well as to the other members of the community bank, with whom he likes to work. Edwin plans to invest the proceeds in the purchase the necessary products needed for his wife to continue preparing meals, this way generating more income.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Electrical repairs
